The DJ was cool so the atmosphere was great. There was also hookah available which was even better. We had such a blast we didn't leave until 530 or 6 lol!

Came here after a cruise and before a flight (had about 5 hours to kill). They stored our luggage for free. We ate at the restaurant and then hung out at their private beach until we needed to go to the airport. There are showers and bathrooms so perfect for travelers. Right next to the airport so we didn't hit any traffic. Very friendly staff!

This is a criticism. I ordered a dozen oysters and got 8. I ask about the count and they said because they were so big that they only serve 8. The menu says clearly states half dozen and a dozen, not weight. Just because they buy large oysters is not my problem. They need to change the menu if They want to change by the weight. I have been coming here for 5 years and this has never been a problem. This is just an example of low character of the management on duty, But to be fair it is usually a good bar and the wait staff is very excellent
Very subpar. Read other yelp reviews and hoped it was ok here anyway. Nachos had a big meatball of taco meat which was very pink inside. Find somewhere else.

Came to Whiskey Joes for lunch. It has great sitting outside on the patio and inside with wide open windows overlooking the ocean. Amazing views and their portion sizes of food are excellent for sharing! 
I ordered their bowl of Spicy Island Gumbo ($8 & large size) and it tasted good and could be a meal if you were looking for a little bit lighter lunch portion. Also ordered the Snapper in Paradise which was at least a 6oz piece of fish topped with tomatoes and sauce that was delicious. It came with two sides and I ordered the broccoli and fries. ($26) Wasn't too fond of the broccoli, needed seasoned and was half way raw. It is slightly higher in price, but know that their portions make up for it and the sizes are worth the price. 
Only other thing that I didn't know is that there is valet parking only in their lot which is $5. 
I didn't get to go on the beach area because it was windy and slightly raining, but looks great and relaxing! Will be back to sit out and relax in the sun!

*************
Updated September 5, 2018

Came here for lunch today and went out to the beach area for the first time. What an amazing spot to sit, relax, listen to music, have a cocktail and some great tasting seafood! 

Tons of beach chairs to sit on (none to lay on to tan your back side) with tiki huts and high tops to sit at as well. They have a nice large tiki bar outside with full bar and a few TVs. You can order food at the bar and they will bring it out (look out for seagulls!) 

Ordered the coconut crusted mahi on the appetizer menu and it was delicious! It was $14 with two kinds of sauces including mango / orange flavor and a sweet chili sauce which were both good. And large portion! Def can split this appetizer or have it as your meal. Great food and view of the ocean! Can't wait to come back for their happy hour from 4:00-7:00
Best Beer Cheese Soup in town and the Calamari Appetizer was great, but prices are a little high though.

Very disappointing meal. The beer wasn't cold but the food was. After sending back a raw hamburger, I received another that tasted like it was made the day before. My wife had the fish tacos. They were ok, but nothing spectacular. The views of the bay are great, too bad the food doesn't match.

Great for casual waterfront dining or drinks. The food is good, but priced a little higher than maybe what it should be. They have a great beer selection along with a full bar. It is a great place to watch the sunset on a nice evening. They are dog friendly on the deck. 

Also, if you are driving know that the parking lot is valet only (it is complementary, but if you don't have extra cash for a tip it can make for an awkward interaction).
New Years was awesome! Two bands, one inside and one outside on the beach. Low cover and plenty of drinks. The staff were very nice. Great way to bring in 2017.
Food was alright, service not so good but our waitress/bartender was nice. the view was great and really enjoyed the sun set on beach and drinking hurricanes.

We sat on the "beach" and enjoyed some adult beverages while listening to the loudest, most annoying rap music ever.  Sorry - I want Jimmy Buffet or Bob Marley while on the beach.  Hate rap so it will always effect my reviews.  Food was bad too.  You would think an order of peel and eat shrimp on a Florida beach would be a no brainer but this was tasteless and mushy.  Waitress though was really good and attentive - 4 starts for her - just wish I could remember her name!

WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!! I've ordered take out before and loved the coconut chicken. However this time we decided to go in and enjoy the atmosphere (Terrible decision). The food was dropped off by another employee who we asked if we could have silverware. 5 minutes go by no silverware and our server was no where to be found. We then went to the bar and asked for silverware but we're not given napkins. We were hungry so we started eating but eventually wanted napkins, of course server still no where to be found. We asked another employee for napkins and then our server came out of no where and began cussing and arguing with us saying he gave us silverware..? We asked to speak to a manager instead of being cursed at and the manager didn't do anything but take a drink off of our check. Not to mention the entire time the server was standing behind the manager flicking us off. This is unbelievable service for a place in such a nice location. I will most definitely never come back nor will anyone I know if it's up to me.

Extremely dissatisfied and disappointed customer a group of us about 50 people ages 40 to 60yrs from Apollo Beach got together and had a pub crawl  wiskey Joes  was our 2nd stop it all started 1st Beach area was not open as promised so group had to go in by bar area then ordered a drink then bartender wouldn't take credit card for payment because no chip in card said it was their policy so told her forget it here's cash then went to patio outside with wife and friends we are all standing talkin all sudden  a staff member comes rushing out  to patio agressively and raised voice at me asking if I put the umbrella up I said no then he says just leave it don't touch it and storms off I'm looking at everyone like what just happened.then one of the ladies in our group was celebrating her birthday so part of group started singing  Happy birthday and then manager comes over and says everyone in group is now cut off from food and alcohol and some people already ordered and paid for food which some didn't even get to enjoy their meal basically paid for something for nothing.and they kicked us out what a shame this is how they run a business turning away people who can spend money  which most business would welcome shame on those who manage to run this place along with  staff. U are going to sink this business u keep this up and don't wisen up
This place sucks. Takes an hour to get food, and nothing special about the food. Their house beers aren't good either, best to stick to some craft beer.

Awesome spot right on the beach! Easy to get to & very accommodating! Casual and fun, you can sit outside right over the water or stay inside with great water views too! They have multiple bars and fun coconut drinks. I had the best fish sandwich - huge portions & bf had the white sand pizza. Both very delicious as we sat and looked out at the water & the Pelicans.

Our waiter, Alex, was extremely friendly and happy to serve us! He made it a fun time here right from the start! ask for him! 

This has been one of the best spots I've been to yet down here in FL!

If I could give an extra half star I would it does not quite rate the full 3.  The service was slow, the food was less than stellar but.... i knew what i was getting into.  what this place my lack in quality and efficiency it makes up for in location....  it is literally just a couple of minutes from the airport and makes a great "last stop before you go" place to grab a cocktail as you await your flight (or waiting to pick someone up).  Sand, Water and a tiki bar!   I will say that the parking is a nightmare so your best bet is to just pay for valet.....  but again, its a BAR ON THE BEACH, that was what I was looking for!

We visited this terrible establishment on New Year's Eve in which we were greeted with judgement, outrageous prices for bottom shelf liquor and ran out of Yeungling after one drink ( both times I've been here they run out after one drink). If you enjoy being overcharged for crappy drinks and average food then this is the place for you. I recommend this place dearly to all of my enemies. Never. The portopotties are free, but you lose a few ounces of humanity and if you want to use the facilities inside you have to pay a cover. WTF? Sincerely a disgruntled customer

The food is fine - typical beach bar food. The PARKING IS HORRENDOUS. They have only valet parking and when that fills up they tell you to park off site at another location. The process is longer and annoying and it will make you 30-45 minutes late if you have an reservation. The hostess staff was also not very understanding or helpful in regards to some of our party being delayed due to Whiskey Joe's parking situation breakdown. Go to the light and make the U turn because you'll wait 20 minutes to turn into the restaurant only to be told you can't park there. UPDATE: Valet parking is $5 and cash only at the off site parking with a free shuttle. Those guys are awesome and really put up with a lot, tip them well! The free parking ,on the very small Ben T Davis Beach, is not an ideal option because you enter and exit from the same point as WJ customers. The beach parking is backed up with a line of cars waiting to exit but only after the cars entering the lot to try to valet park clear up. I watched them to sit in their cars to leave the lot longer than I did to enter it. It would have been helpful if at the time our reservation was made we were told "Hey, it gets insanely busy and packed here. Your party should arrive 30-45 minutes early."  We spoke to our server about her experience and they also are late due to the same traffic issues as was the server/worker who was in the free shuttle ride with me. Spring break or not, we have great weather most of the time, I'm positive this is a regular occurrence. Just be ready to deal with some hassles and to wait, prepare in advance. I wish someone told us - so I'm telling you. BTW-uncle bens minute rice is very TYPICAL - I didn't say it was bad, it's just what you would expect.

I went here on a Sunday, which is reggae night and there is a cover charge to go down on the beach. The only reason why I went here is because I had a friend coming into town and she wanted to go here so I met her there.

The parking is ridiculous. Most of the lot is valet and if they are full you are screwed. When I first arrived, it was full so I had to go to the adjacent beach parking to try and find a spot. The parking machine was not giving people receipts, which you are supposed to put on your dash so they know you paid. I did not put money in and decided to try the restaurant again because in the meantime my friend got there and she was able to park. Well the parking gods must have smiled on me because I snagged a non-valet spot on the way to valet.

I am in my 40s and this is not my scene. The waitress was dingy and I paid cash because I didn't feel comfortable giving them my card and having them hold it at the bar.

The place was pretty packed though and there were cops watching from a deck above, as well as cops patrolling the water because the waterway is between two party spots (this place and the Beach) so I would say that is plus.

There did seem to be a pretty good band that was starting when I was going home so it may be a really good place to go for live music.

I think I would feel different about the place if parking wasn't such a pain and if I was on vacation.  I live here though and in Pinellas County there are a lot of beach bars I would pick over this place, but because it is located in Hillsborough, near the airport and hotels, I am guessing it is popular among people who don't want to drive all the way out to the beach.

VEGAN REVIEW: We came down for Parents weekend at UT and this place was a request of non-vegan family members. Full disclosure we did review the menu beforehand and saw there was only 2 possible items that could have been veganized: Hummus appetizer and a veggie pizza. 
Great ambiance with that Caribbean outback vibe. Pulling up... there is a long valet line and long waits for tables. If you want to skip the restaurant, the "beach" is first come first serve. More about that later. 
We opted for outdoor seating on the water. Pretty views and the weather was perfect for outdoor dining. Our waiter was friendly and accommodating. Fun drink menu with zany names and concoctions. We ordered the hummus plate as an appetizer without the tsaztsiki.  It was actually the best hummus plate I've had aside from Greek restaurants...came with olives, marinated cherry tomatoes, banana peppers, pita and cucumbers. We asked our waiter if the chef could prepare something special for us considering they had pasta and veggies. He made a linguine with brushetta, olive oil and mushrooms. I requested a side of the mango salsa and mixed it in there. It was decent for a meal but I wonder why they couldn't have a black bean burger on their menu. I find this so often and news flash: veganism isn't a new fad...it's been around for 70+ years as an American lifestyle and diet and much longer in other cultures. I understand a local whiskey seafood shanty isn't going to have garlic roasted tofu with a balsamic reduction over steamed quinoa but is a black bean burger with avocado and mango salsa too much to ask for? 
And the beach...we decided to go check it out. Definitely a fun place to hang. Firepits, tiki torches, live music, cocktails, sand...what's not to love? Good times and definitely a place I'd love to return to as soon as they get a couple more vegan options.

We had a great time here yesterday. We have only been once before and we really like it. 
Julia is a great bartender and we will definitely be back.

We discovered this great spot on a business trip to Tampa. The food, service, and atmosphere were excellent. Our server Neil, took such good care of us and was a great person! There is a deck to sit and enjoy the view too.

Amazing location! On the beach with the coolest vibe. Watching the jet skiers was great and the sunset was beautiful. You can eat on the deck or on the beach. My sister and I ate inside seated by the windows. Great view! The staff are pleasant and helpful. My sister had the Jerk chicken sandwich and fries. She said it was very good. I ordered the grouper sandwich that came with fries, coleslaw. The grouper was bland, not even salt. It could have used some seasoning like garlic, salt, paprika and crushed thyme. Try it! The fries were to salty. The drinks were great! Atmosphere great! The grouper average. You may wonder way I gave them 4 stars. I'm not going to give them a low score based on one bland meal.
Had the carnitas, 10/10 would come again, prices aren't terrible considering the area, and the proportions were handsome.

We had the Jamaican fish and the fried seafood platter. Everything was excellent, but the Jamaican sauce was just ok (not great). Prices are very reasonable considering the quality of the food. Service outside by the bar was fast and polite. The food came out quickly and the sunset was beautiful. I highly recommend!

Recommended by my sister and was not disappointed. Wings were exceptional and calamari strips were very good!  Drinks were on point and souvenir cups were a nice addition for keepsake purposes.  Enjoyed the view as well.  Thanks!

I was in town and my friend brought my here. The food was amazing and plentiful. I also love that they had the outside bar on the water. We ate inside and then went outside. The service inside was great. The service outside could have been better, seems like it took forever to get anyone's attention. I would definitely come here again when I'm in town.

What a great spot to enjoy a view of the water with a cocktail and grab a bite to eat. We had the grouper sandwich and the mini sliders, have I had better, yes but the food was still pretty good. Lets face it you go to the place for water views and fun. Joe's has a big deck with a 8 seat bar that looks over the water, seems likes a good place to grab the view you probably came here for. They have a barefoot beach bar that looks like fun too if you want sand in between your toes and a cold beer in your hand.
Killer on the beach joint! Blackened fish tacos local Cigar City beer! Great server thanks Beth!! Must do classic Fla place!

Being an out-of-towner, this place was recommended to me by a few different people. It did not disappoint. Large beach with fireplaces set up for these cool October nights. Good selection of local craft brews. The food for our party of three arrived on time ,was piping hot and tasted delicious. The view of the Bay from our little Tiki table was also soothing and relaxing, especially watching the boats come in and dock.

I can not believe I never reviewed this place. Why have I gone here a bunch of times?  Well, it is a step from the airport. People I pick up from the airport or take to the airport end up here.
This place has a great view of the water. This is a typical touristy place where you feel like you are in Florida bc the sun is shining in all directions and the heat is permeating you to the max. It's nice and they have tiki huts also that I have not been able to get to. They allow dogs as well. The menu is the usual grill kind of place and not that extraordinary. The drinks are great though and they have great service. I'm sure I will be back when I have more visitors come.

If you want a restaurant where you can watch the sunset on tampa this is the place. They have a private beach with corn hole and volleyball along with a beach bar. The food here is ok but I like whiskey joe's more as a place to hangout and grab a drink with my toes buried in the sand.

Beautiful place to relax with a few drinks and watch the sunset. At night they have bonfires scattered along the beach and it's a very relaxed atmosphere with great music. They also have jet skis to rent if you're feeling a little adventurous!

Honestly, this place was a HUGE disappointment. We had slow service from start to finish. It took 20+ minutes to get our drinks and another 30+ minutes to get our appetizers. Conveniently, it took 10 minutes to get our main dishes. I ordered the Jambalaya, which was delicious and very hot, temperature wise. My friend ordered the Shrimp Tacos which was all mayonnaise and grease with ice cold fried shrimp. One side of the table was given their plates of food while the other side of the table waited another 10 minutes for their food. The waiter completely forgot to get one of our friend's food. I will say that we had a 12 top table, but the restaurant appeared very slow. They didn't even give our waiter a helper given the party size. He spent so much time running around and he seemed very flustered.

Basically a beach bar targeting tourists.   A fine view or Tampa Bay from the Tampa side of Courtney Campbell, with lots of deck seating and natural breeze.  Drinks are fine but predictably pricey.  Service is relaxed.  Just had some apps from the usual list of tacos, wraps, and fried seafood.

A way to spend a Sunday afternoon, right on the water. The drinks tasty and the food was  good, the only complaint was the required valet service. There was a wait for us to retrieve our vehicle and congested leaving the parking lot.

i super enjoyed this place, i had the carnitas and they were spectacular, also tried the pork tacos which were full of so much pork, omg so good!  be cautious of the pizza though, its listed as "new york style" and its simply a flatbread pizza, that's not new york style at all, it tasted good though, just thought we were getting something else
I liked everything here, from food to ambience. A perfect place to have good food and enjoy a beautiful sunset. Being on a sea shore is just the right place to be in  loved it!

Yes the uniforms the staff has to wear hurts my eyes and you know you are at some type of tourist location as you pass through Ye Olde Gift Shoppe on your way in and out of the attraction but...
I've only eaten there recently at lunch and was lucky enough not to get attacked or by a flock angry sea gulls and if they would have pooped on me I would have ran, ran so far away I could have got away.
Back to the food, two salads, one appetizer and a couple of glasses of house Sauvignon were ordered. I have to agree it was not the least expensive lunch and if it wasn't for the beautiful surroundings, pleasant staff and decent food I would probably drive past in the future but....

Have to start with the view. The wife and I are huge fans of food on the water, especially coming from the desert, and Whiskey Joe's doesn't disappoint. It's right on the causeway and the patio is right on Tampa Bay. We went for mid-week lunch and I wish I had tried the gator bites. The firecracker shrimp tacos were fantastic as was her requisite chicken sandwich since she doesn't eat seafood. Service was solid ... and did I mention the views?

I have been going to Whiskey  Joe's  since the original one opened. Yes, it can feel touristy, but if you are a Native, it can also feel like home.
Surrounded by Tampa Bay, a beack, outside bar, Tiki, you can put your toes in the sand & bring your best 4 legged friend. Who can't find something to love about that vibe, not me.
Parking is a pure nightmare! Just be prepared for it before you go & it won't ruin your fun. Service is generally good, as they want to keep you eating & drinking. The food, defiantly not stellar or even close.
I used to experiment with different dishes and just got too frustrated. I really enjoy their Wisconsin  Cheddar  soup & boiled shrimp, a perfect meal for me. You can't mess up the soup, it's  premade. The shrimp occasionally  come overcooked or too soggy, but they have no problem replacing them.
A great place to chill and enjoy where you live!
What's  a  girl  to  do? Try to enjoy where I live & take advantage of places that put me in my element of water & sunshine.
Nice view on water.  It was recommended by the concierge desk at hotel.  Limes in my mojito were old. (brown edges)   The blackened grouper was average.   Not much fish and the shrimp rubbery.

They get a 1 star because it was a gorgeous place to eat with a gorgeous view. But everything else was bad. My wife had a live beetle crawling around the pecans in her salad. And that was their signature salad.  They took it off the bill but didn't offer a bug less one. We called ahead for a party of 12 and then waited more than an hour after we got there. They had quoted 30-40 minutes.  The service was excruciatingly slow.  The fish dinners were too greasy to eat.  We don't recommend the swashbuckler as it is just a tub of greasy fish and fries. We would never go there again, and everyone in our party agrees. Save yourself from starvation and wanting to throw up and go somewhere else!

Whiskey Joe's has done a lot to improve this restaurant over the years. The have waterfront seating and a beach tiki bar. Both make for an enjoyable Florida atmosphere when the weather is right.  During my recent visit I got the naked colada which is basically a pina colada mixed with delicious black spiced rum. The Jamaican Jerk chicken sandwich was served with yummy fries. Both were pretty good. Sit outside and enjoy a frozen drink....it might smell a little funky....don't worry you get used to it :)

You completely suck as an establishment. Unprofessional staff including management. Place for drama and boring. You can't handle large groups. You lose profit because of how you run your business. You cater to trash instead. You turn down people that can actually spend money here and trash talk to other businesses if those groups are headed there. Don't bother to have your piss aunts even communicate on your behalf. You will loose a lot of business.

Totally confused about the low ratings I'm seeing. Stumbled upon this place on our way to Clearwater. Jumped off of the road to grab lunch and ended up staying and enjoying the awesome beach ambience. I had the shrimp scampi appetizer and my friend had fish and chips. We also shared a nacho/queso/beef appetizer. We enjoyed everything we had!! The bartenders were great at the bar and we enjoyed our drinks, as well. We came back later the same night because they have a separate tiki bar, firepits, & performance stage. We had a blast listening to the DJ and later the live band. We also ended up eating dinner there. My friend had the steak tacos and I had wings. We enjoyed our dinner, too! Perfect beach bar, equipped with entertainment at night. Can't beat it!!!

If I could select NO STAR I would. Horrible service and really quite frankly the WORST food I have EVER had!!!! It was so bad that I actually threw up shortly after the dinner. Over cooked fish and microwaved veggies!!! We also ordered pizza that totally was freezer burned with bad veggies! Do NOT go here. You have been warned!!

You really can't beat the view here. They have their own private sandy beach. I chilled with some good friends earlier in the day on a weekday so it wasn't that busy, which was great because iv'e seen this place get PACKED!  
There is nothing better than some cold beer on a hot ass day with some sandbags to play a few games of sand bag toss with your buddies. We stayed and watched the sunset. Tried some food, the fish tacos were nasty, my friends had the pulled pork sandwiches. Too salty for them. The food is meh. 
Don't expect it to be as great as the view. I would have rated it a five if the food was good. Whiskey Jose's is a wonderful hang out if you are lookin to have a good time with your friends and get some drinks.

The owners certainly listened in school when they taught the #1 rule of business is location, location, location! Unfortunately I think they realize they will be successful on tourists regardless of service or food. Service was a cluster; table next to us was smoking cigarettes non-stop until I had to say something; and WHO THE F? SERVES SEAFOOD GUMBO WITH RAW UNCOOKED RICE?????!!!!

This place is located near the airport so it is a great palce to head to if i ever have a friend or family friend on a layover between catching their next flight. We inicially came here because we wanted to have a beer while watching the sunset. Whiskey joe has limited free parking but they have paying parking nearby. During happy hour this place is packed. They had yeunling at $3 and some drinks at $6.  On our first round we ordered two yeunglings but on our second round i decided to try the margarita and it was not worth it. Next time i'm sticking to beer. We also wanted to share a bite to eat and ordered flat crusted cheese pizza (8 pieces). It was just ok- nothing to write about but i would not order it again. I would probably return when if a friend is on a layover. Other than that, i'd probably head elsewhere.
I ordered the gator bites & we got more fried pickles than gator bites never again! They slackin! The server did nothing about it either!
Amazing food!! Veggie pizza is a must! Their beach bar is the perfect place to unwind and the live music is always entertaining! Reasonably priced as well!! Must visit!

In town for the Memorial Day Holiday Weekend, and stop here for drinks and food! The view is awesome!!! Had some great food and an OUTSTANDING server, ARI! She was very helpful with items suggestions on the menu, very friendly, great customer service! If you are in the area, please stop in and enjoy great water views, live music, and ask for ARI for superb service! Thanks ARI!!!
Great location, good food. Prices are a bit high for the quality but the location doesn't get better. Great for any age or crowd. Beautiful sunsets.

We never actually got to order any food.  When we arrived, we were told there would be a 30 minute wait.  We decided to wait )wound up being 45 minutes).  When we were seated, took another 30 minutes until someone took our order.  30 more minutes and still no food.  When we finally flagged down our server, she said she would check on it and did not return for another 20 minutes and which point we left.  Terrible service!

I asked the concierge at my hotel for a local dive that sold good food cheap. This place is not that.  It's a tourist trap with mediocre food and moderate prices.  I should have known when I walked in and saw a gift shop selling Whiskey Joe's tee shirts.  I was hungry and it was traffic hour so I stayed rather than try to find some other place. 

I ordered the blackened grouper and it came out quickly. The first thing I noticed was that it appeared everything was reheated including the fish. The "fresh steamed" vegetables were still cold as was the rice. The cold was not room temp, but fridge cold.  I gave the fish a shot and it was just ok. It may have been reheated as well since the blackened portions had no crisp. Overall it was disappointing.

Nothing spectacular but just what you want in a cheesy beachside resturant/bar. Alligator heavy decor, lovely view of the water, indoor & outdoor seating, reasonable prices, ok food. We had the gator bites (yum), firecracker shrimp (chewy but liked the sweet & sour sauce), bbq pizza (my boyfriend was a fan, there was a lot of meat on it - pork & bacon) & Caribbean Cobb salad (I loved it - mango, pineapple & fresh jalapeño in addition to your standard Cobb salad ingredients). Slow but friendly service.

Ehhh, unlikely I will return.  Quick Version: Bad service and everyone looks like they'd rather be somewhere else.

I arrived to the restaurant and since I was a party of one, they assumed that I did not want a table.   The host and hostess kind of waved me in the area of the bar seating.  I asked for a table, (there were obviously plenty available), and I was pressured to sit in bar area.  I sat in Bar for almost 20 minutes without being greeted.  FYI, I counted the time on my phone.  

Mind you all employees are chatting each other up, and playing and interacting with each other. Although some appeared busy there was definitely a choice to be inattentive.  

In addition, why does it look like everyone just rolled out of bed?  I get a laid back environment in addition to working in outdoor conditions, however, I would expect to be groomed with decent clothes at your workplace.  The ladies all wear messy buns and look like they haven't combed their hair since yesterday.   It appears that the employees where their "old" workout gear or tethered clothes because they are in a laid back environment.  There are multiple ways to present yourself as groomed and well managed in a laid back environment.  

I eventually was able to flag someone walking by, and they told me that I was not in their section.   The next thing I know, a bartender shouted that she would be with me.  I was rushed to order cocktail.  Never offered any water, I had to get her attention again for the appetizer.  Meanwhile, she took more than enough time at every other table.  Carrying on light conversations and again conversing with other employees. 

 After 45 minutes, I decided that I would just leave.  I am cannot beg for a server to provide decent service.   I cannot believe I was at a restaurant for an hour to receive one cocktail and an appetizer.  I left and went to Bahama Breeze for dinner!  It was Amazing. Would highly recommend you avoid this place (Whiskey Joe's)  and go to Bahama Breeze if you want good food/cocktails, live music, and great service!

I will say that my Island Firecracker shrimp was delish, but not enough to suffer through bad service!

I don't understand why this place has so many bad reviews. We were on our way to the stadium and we went to have a bite before the game. The views were amazing. The service was excellent and the food was very good. For appetizer we ordered the black bean hummus... it was delicious. My husband an I shared the sliders plate and my kids had the mahi nuggets, everything was really good. The parking is valet only, very convenient. Only $5. Would go back anytime.

5 stars for the view.
3 stars for everything else. 

If you want to feel like you're on vacation- and enjoy the sunset- without fighting traffic to the beach- then head to Whiskey Joe's.  Take a seat on the outdoor patio for unparalleled views of the sunset....or cozy up to a bonfire on the beach.  

The food is OK- good, but overpriced. I've never had anything I didn't like here- but I've also never had anything that blew me away.  Wine and beer are reasonably priced- especially during happy hour. But expect to pay a little more for a boat drink.  

The indoor bar area is equipped with a lot of TVs- so it's a great place to watch a sporting event as well.  

I used to frequent Whiskey Joe's when I lived on Rocky Point- and went back there last week for the first time in a while for a friend's going away celebration. We had a lovely time chilling on the beach, huddled around a bonfire, telling stories and looking forward to the future!

If you didn't have to order anything from servers, this place would get five stars. However, the service and food gets a 2 or a 3.   

It's an awesome location on the water with great views. They also have the "barefoot bar" on the beach outside. That's my favorite part. It hardly seems worth it to go inside. The service is extremely slow about 90% of the time and the food is...blah.  Great drinks and scenery totally make this place.

Basically a drink review only.pulled right up on the beach on a pontoon boat with 6 people. Waitress jumped up with menus before we could even tie up the boat! Steak tacos and a bowl of soup ordered by 2. No complaints were heard. The drinks were served cold,often and fairly priced. Very good service slso

I come here over and over, but it is only for the great outdoor patio and the views. The outdoor waitstaff has always been great. I've tried eating here many times and the food is not good. Poor quality and very basic. I am not even a great cook and can cook better than this place.

Good food, good service! Average bar food, excellent atmosphere. Relaxing and casual, the bar beach area is great for that! Great view from the restaurant area or beach are! 
Brought some out of town guests here for the very reason.

Drinks  $9 to $12. Coconut margarita tasted horrible. Not mixed well at all. Other margarita flavors same issue. Not worth the money. You pay for the scenery. Get a beer in a bottle or can you cant mess that up. View is nice loud all dam night until 3am. Poor choice in music.
Great food, great service, and beautiful views. Service was perfect, ample choices on the menu, and drinks were tasty.

Visited last week , the only thing that was good was the nachos appetizer , waitress forgot to even put in my soup order in and then gave it to me at the same time as my meal after I asked her for it three times . When I received my meal the chicken and rice were ice cold and the cheese sauce on my broccoli was like water . The other two meals in my party were not hot either , sangria was fine but the Bloody Mary's had no fixings and we watched two other tables served then with olives and the rest of the fixings which was disappointing . $110 not edible meal .

Loved our time here. Stopped in after the game and enjoyed the beach and outdoor area while we waited for our table. (They do take reservations.) We were seated at a table for 8. Ordered quickly and had our food in a decent amount of time given this place was jam packed! 

Staff was efficient and friendly. Food was great. Prices were fair given the area and ambience. Kid friendly.

One of the best beach bars in the Tampa area. You get a little bit of everything, whether it's areas inside with tons of TVs to watch sports on and a phenomenal view of the water from the windows covering 3 sides of the building or outside at the tiki bar right on the beach. Tons of variety when it comes to drinks and they have some great seafood options as well ( big fan of the house oysters). They do live music outside on a small stage most evenings and have jet ski rentals right next door as well.

Madison, gets 4 stars, that helped us at the restaurant was great! But Catherine G. at the outside tiki area, when we asked for our check, she came back and fanned out 10 credit cards and asked "Which one is yours?", um she should have only asked what our name was on the card.
The key lime pie is a must! Best damn key lime pie i have had!  Had the best services and nice view of the water.

I really enjoyed this place. Great atmosphere. Sits right on the water. You can watch the sun go down amongst palm trees and the beach. The crowd is lively and a great place to watch games. The drink menu is solid and the food really good! I went with guava strawberry ribs and was not disappointed.

Great place to eart if you wanna be outside on the beach!

Gator bites-came with fried pickles...this whole meal tasted like fish...even the pickles..not much gator either, mostly pickles

Whiskey burger in paradise-it was good, i would try a different one if i get to visit here again.

This is a nice restaurant right on a nice little beach. Gets very busy... Great view of the water and Sunset. Really enjoyed the water and drinks. The staff was pleasant And really enjoyed our visit! Will definitely return again!

Great location but consistently you will receive very poor service. It took them 25 min to tell me my beer I ordered was out. Then wait until it's time to pay.....good luck. Lol. Very very poor service.  At least they are consistent and you know it's going to be bad.

The sunset views were great, but that was about it tonight.

When we arrived we were told a 45 minute wait for a group of 7. I did not receive a text until 1 hour and 10 minutes later. After going to the hostess stand, they brought us to a table which another party was sitting out, which caused another 10-15 minute delay. Luckily the hostess was able to resolve the issue. Upon ordering our food, it took over an hour and every single meal came out cold. After arriving to a restaurant at 7 and not receiving meals until after 930 it was quite disappointing that everything came out cold. We were all too hungry to care and ate our meals anyway. Overall it was a disappointing night.
Went here a few times during my two week stay in Tampa. Friendly staff, tasty food, and FANTASTIC brews!!!

I love the location and the drinks are great! However, the service near the beachside is horrible!  I say that because I was charged $173.30 for an order that was not mine. I had a $15 bill that was canceled after I signed and paid my check and left the restaurant! Wow! Don't pay with your card - I recommend paying only with cash for your bill if you sit out by the beachside! The staff is stressed by the crowds and our server actually lost a card from our party and in addition to the error mentioned above, she also charged another card in our party with four different checks! Crazy! Chris, the manager offered me a free appetizer and a drink on my next visit and says he's not charging me once the charges are reversed.  This is just a hassle! Is there not enough staff or is it a bad register system. Maybe consider getting iPads that the servers can use to cash folks out at the beachside instead of running back and forth. This makes me very concerned about returning! A check for $14 is very off from a check for $173!!! I'm still getting this mess cleared up with my bank!!! Beware- pay with cash only folks!!!

Also- be prepared to valet park for $5 and pay $5 (cash only) to get into the beachside area to order food and drinks.
Horrible service, food sucked & so did the personalities of every employee we came in contact with. When in Tampa/Clearwater again this place will be skipped.

Seated at beach table. No one came to offer us drinks or menus. My friend went to get menus and 20 mins after we still were NOT waited on! Poor customer service. Obviously they do not want our business. We are leaving now without having a drink, any food, and or ANY interaction with staff.

Nice location. Great service. She was very attentive and sweet. Gave us great recommendations on what to order. The food was decent. Got the steak tacos, fries and coconut mahi nuggets. The fruit drinks were good. We were sitting outside facing the beach. Enjoying the cool breeze. We parked down the beach. We are after a day at the beach. It was nice that it was right off the beach so we didn't have to go far to eat. Def Check it out. Prices not bad. Def would come back if I'm in the area. The restaurant was clean and the bathrooms were too.

Love this place! 
Casual, fun, good vibes beach bar/restaurant. 
My kind of place right by the water. Surprisingly never over crowded. Good drinks & food, nothing outrageous. I go for the atmosphere and the view.
Enjoy!

My first experience at whiskey joes will be my last. The food was over priced and none of the six people at my party enjoyed their meal. We waited WAY too long for our drink order. The waitress was nice and did keep saying she was waiting for the bar to finish them. It was a Tuesday night and not busy. The appetizers came out before our drinks and the oysters were the smallest I've ever seen.

I came here on a trip to Tampa and I ate here on my very last night. I had the time of my life drinking virgin margaritas and playing corn hole in the sand. The pizza was pretty rad and I will come back on my next trip to Tampa

I give this place 3 stars instead of 2 because the location is superb!  It's located on the causeway between several tourist hotels, not far from the airport highway, and the tackiest beach bar, Hulk Hogan's restaurant right there.  Chop House, Bahama Breezes are there too, so this is a tourist and conference epicenter which usually means that the food can be lower quality and higher priced.  

And this is case here.  Really.  It's always packed, you have to valet park, unless you want to pay & park at the near by beach.  The entrance has a tacky shop with t-shirts, hats, goo-ga with their logo.  It's very tourist.  

If you are a local, don't bother.  The drinks and food isn't worth the, admittedly, gorgeous sunsets.  The only reason I ever go here is when I have clients in town.  They have a hidden (if you don't know - you won't find it) bar and outside eating area on the beach.  There is a limited menu out there, but my clients' feet in the sand, playing corn hole and drinking beer, makes them happy.

Bottom line: mediocre food, crowded, touristy, high drink prices, pretty views.

Bang for your buck: 6/10
Quality: 7/10
Service: 5/10
Ambiance/Location: 10/10
Overall: 6/10

Great grouper! Service wasn't great despite not being busy. It's a bit pricey for what it is. Great view of the bay!

Love this place for the outdoor beach bar... The amosphere is chill and good music when they have the reggae bands. 
However... if you want food or drinks forget about it. It literally took over 30 min just to get a drink at the outside bar. Totally unacceptable no matter how busy it was. Bartenders would just keep walking by and look away when they notice u trying to get their attn. There goes your tips. IJS 
Then we eventually found an open table but couldn't get someone to take an order for anything. One waitress just said I dont know,  I dont know what to tell you when I asked if or how we can place a food order. Then we finally got a waiters attention and he said they arent taking more orders. But its only 8:20 pm and u literally just took orders from 2 or 3 other tables near ours. 
And dont get me started on parking... It is valet only unless u park in the meter lot next to it. 
BUT that lot closes and gets locked up before the place closes. 
So if u do go be prepared for parking issues and horrible service. You need alot of patience to come here and really enjoy it.
We parked at Bahama Breeze and walked over cause it was just easier and didn't need to worry abt being locked in the meter lot again (yes this has happened to me before). I understand its a "park" lot or whatever but they know ppl are parked there for Whiskey Joes and should not lock it up till after the place closes. Or Whiskey Joes needs to add more parking somehow. 
Needless to say, we ate at Bahama Breeze after we left since Whiskey Joes wouldnt serve us. And we didnt want to eat inside the restaurant after the horrible service outside. 
Taking a break from here for a long long time.

Service and the view were the only decent things there. Yucky drinks, and dried up wings. Seriously over priced. $15 for 10 naked, dried and small wings. Way better choices around, don't go to Whiskey joes!

COOL PLACE! Went on a Monday night and place was still pretty full. Got a nice table outside and watched the sunset. Burger (for me) and veggie pizza for my fiancé was terrific! After we walked on the beach right next door. If you're in the area this is a great place to go at night!

Im giving 2 starts because location is great.. but drinks were weak, food was average or below average.. service was extremely slow ! Our waitress would constantly disappear and then I would find her "playing" with her phone instead of helping out customers... she took FOREVER to bring drinks, food and our check ! Very frustrating... and also make sure u DONT use their valet service as they were also very slow and seem a little lost on whose car they were supposed to bring out... beach parking is right next to restaurant and easy to park and pay ! I really wanted to like this place because like I said here, the location its great.. especially for people from Tampa who dont want to drive all the way to overcrowded clearwater or St pete!

View is amazing, and you actually have a good view of the water throughout the restaurant which is a huge plus.  Service was a little slow, but decent. The pork tacos are delish!  Husband said the burger was average.   A-ok for a casual lunch/dinner!

My husband and I really enjoyed our meal here.  We started with the nacho's, they were delicious!  And coming from Southern California, we're picky about our nacho's.  My husband got wings and I got a Caesar salad for our main course but we only ate about 1/4 of our meal, due to being so full from the nacho's.

When we walked in we were asked if we'd like to be seated indoors or out, we requested out.  The hostess asked another hostess, who was just standing there, if they had any available tables outside, she responded by hunching her shoulders and saying "I don't know".  Our hostess took us out there anyway and found us a table.  Our waiter was very young and seemed a bit inexperienced, he was attempting to take our plates and drinks away before we were finished.  But he was very polite and doing his best.  I had a Margarita on the rocks which was really good!  Great view of the water too.

Our waitress Madison was very helpful and knowledgeable with the menu, she was good with checking on us. We ordered the ribs, burger, wings, and the chips and queso, for drink we got the Miami vice. The food was not what we expected, maybe because we got here at 9:30 pm and on a Monday night. The ribs had loads of fat, the burger was dried, the wings had a weird after smell to it. The drink was delicious. Their fries is the best! 
We told our waitress and she took care of us immediately with the managers help. We will try it again but during the day time and not too close to closing time. The view is impressive!

I ignored the reviews. Wish I had not. This place was cool due to its location and the ambiance is cool. But seriously, that's where it ended. With so many places to choose from, I wish we had gone to lolis first. So much better food and insane that we paid 1/2 the price even after our meal was comped for tasting like crap (soggy fish that the birds ended up not even taking) yeah, won't be back.

Five of us went here for dinner last Sunday after hanging out at Hogan's Beach. We spilt the nachos as an appetizer and they were the best I've had in a long time. I had the lobster and shrimp mac & cheese. It was pricey at $20, but worth every penny! I could only eat about a quarter of it after having some nachos, but it was just as delicious re-heated at home. The service was so-so, but the food more than made up for it.

Nothing to write home about. Would've ordered more had you seen me--a single, older woman with high disposable income--as a guest rather than an imposition. Forced to sit at bar with very poor service. "Garden" side salad is large portion but only yellowing iceberg lettuce. Black beans and rice (side) decent. The order and my tip would've been much larger had you found a way to seat me at a table and serve me.

What a great place to stop in for a quick bite and beautiful sunset before boarding my flight.  Really good food, and Marquis was an awesome server.  The drinks were a little pricey, but that's the norm for touristy areas. The outside seating is plentiful, as are the stunning views. Overall, we had a great experience, and I will definitely stop by and check it out again- expecially for a pre flight coctail and meal before traveling- it was just perfect!

Had wings and nachos they were both good. While waiting for a table to be available we sat at the bar. Took a while to get the bartenders attention and actually get a drink. Table service was much better. View of water is nice and good atmosphere outside.

My bf and I went here on a Sat evening around 8pm. The restaurant was semi-empty but there were lots of people at the Barefoot Bar. The bartenders were not very attentive because they didn't even notice us until about 5 min after we sat down. The first bartender asked if we were being helped, we said no, she took our order. Then a min or 2 later another bartender came by and asked if we were being helped. Throughout our stay we noticed that customers who sat down had to wait a long while before either bartenders even noticed they were there. At one point we needed to get another round but couldn't get anyone's attention. One bartender was talking to a group of guys more than paying attention to her customers; she was at the far end of the bar and had her back toward us so she couldn't see me waving my arm to get her attention.

The mixed drinks we ordered were good, the beers are reasonably priced, the music is good as always, being outdoors was nice, and we found out that we could drive our boat right up to the sand, but the bartenders really need to be more attentive to their customers.

I'm still giving the Barefoot Bar a 3 star because my experience didn't improve since my last review.

Alcoholics Anonymous don't live here! Neither do I, but the selections are good but the store could use a little updating. It's kinda cool watching the ladies pull up in their Cadillacs with rollers in their hair at the convenient drive through window, (Werk it ladies!)  cool place!

Rude staff. Nobody really seemed to go out of their way to offer assistance. I would cut them some slack because it is the busy season. However, the prices are pretty high for the mediocre food. If you want a good view of the bay then this is the place to be. Since I'm a local I think next time I'll just go to the bar and skip the restaurant.

Very cool restaurant bar but food is average.  Fun place, nice waitstaff but we ate here 3 times, due to being at a hotel nearby for 12 days, and we tried many items.. Shrimp seafood pasta was the best choice, everything else was ok. Fun beach activities in the evenings. Fire pits, bands etc.  great party place......better for beach fun and drinks.

Eating at Whiskey Joe's may have been the worst dining experience of my life. I stopped by with a few coworkers after work on a nice evening. We were staying at a hotel nearby, so we figured we would go get a few drinks and eat dinner on the water and see the sunset. When walking up to the restaurant, it looks like a good time (nice location on the water with some beach seating)..... boy were we tricked - It was like a mirage.

First off, one of our menus had a band-aid on it. We should have known right then and there to RUN AWAY, but we stayed......We ordered a bunch of things off the menu, calamari, queso dip, and mussels for appetizers; burgers and chicken for dinner; kept it real simple. The only food that was edible was the queso, which shouldn't be surprising since it probably came out of a velveeta can. Do NOT order the calamari - Out of the whole basket, there were probably 5 pieces of small calamari; the rest of the basket was filled with fried sour onions that were shaped to look like calamari, such trickery! The mussels came out an HOUR AFTER the first two appetizers, along with the rest of the meals. The mussels were COLD and had a chewy/tacky consistency. I ate like 4 and almost barfed. I was done at that point. The burgers were also cold and extremely under-cooked. The chicken was covered in so much fried batter, it is probably healthier to eat chicken fingers from McDonald's. 

Now for the service, the entire meal took about 2.5 hours for some simple appetizers and entrees. The restaurant was not even packed. We were barely checked on, and when we were, the waitress asked about the mussels (since we barely touched them) and then immediately said she was leaving and someone else would take over our table. Like K THANKS. 

To top it off, we were seated right behind the outside bar. There was a woman seated at the bar SMOKING and was blowing smoke into our table and food, so that was extremely appetizing also. I would think that even though they have an outdoor bar/dining section, you should still have to go elsewhere to smoke, away from other diners. Isn't that some sort of health code violation?

They close REALLY EARLY but other than that it's a typical bar with a relaxed atmosphere.  They were having some sort of party on the beach while we were there, so we couldn't check it out, but hanging out in the bar was fun with good service and music.

After walking into the beach part, we sat at a table and waited a minute before we flagged down a waitress that said she would be back in a second, 5 mins of sitting in the sun with no drink in hand. We got up to get our own drinks from the bar. A while later after our drinks were over we spotted another female waitress and asked her to come and help she did with no hesitation and a big smile. Her name is Nikki, we asked for drinks and she promptly came back with our shots and beer, with the best attitude that warmed our hearts! I write this still sitting here under this beautiful sun, enjoying the drinks/ day that Nikki made so much better! She is a jewel. You have quite an asset with her! As long as shes here, we will be sure to come back!

This is a review for Whiskey Joe's Barefoot Bar, which is located on the same property as Whiskey Joe's. 

Follow the wooden walkway left of the main building of Whiskey Joe's to where the sand meets the water, that's where you'll find the Barefoot Bar. The floor surrounding the bar is cement, but just a foot or 2 from your chair is all sand. Barefoot Bar offers a full bar and a full food menu. It also has excellent happy hour for drinks. Nearby is a stage. The area in front of the stage is filled with high tops and chairs, all of which is on sand. I believe there's live music Fri-Sun. Between the bar and the water, which is about 40-50 feet away, a few tables with umbrellas that looks like top of a tiki hut are scattered around, which keeps you cool and makes you feel like you're in the tropics. There are also 2 fire pits, to provide ambiance and warmth, if needed.

My friends and I ordered beer, the Whiskey Joe's Calamari (calamari strips, beer battered with peppers and zucchini, served with chipotle mayo) and the Steak Rockets (tender and juicy garlic herb marinated steak, caramelized peppers, onions and cheddar jack wrapped in an egg roll wrapper, served with avocado ranch). The calamari was pretty good, except I feel like the peppers and zucchini are fillers (less calamari). I assume the Steak Rockets were delicious because my friend at the entire thing.

Overall, the atmosphere here is pretty festive and beachy. I think Barefoot Bar is good for happy hour and Fri and Sat evenings if you live in Tampa and are too lazy to drive all the way to the gulf for sand and sunset.

This place is a very cool place to enjoy a good meal. It's off the water, you can request to sit outside but it was a bit breezy for our liking. Parking is by valet, otherwise you have to park on beach and pay to park. That being said, number one rule, always tip valets as you get your car back. 
The food was good, not out of this world good but decent. The reasons I gave this restaurant 3 stars are one,  you cannot simply rely on location. The food has to be timed when brought out, fish should not be salty, wait staff do need to act at least interested, and prices should match quality rather than quantity. 
Offering valet service should give off the sense that you do serve fantastic food, not just okay food. 
Interior reminds me of a fishing lodge, which doesn't go with the beautiful scene outside. It's mix and matching, a bit odd, but I would give it another shot if I was that way.

We throughly enjoyed our experience at Whiskey Joes for lunch..we decided to sit inside because it was a little windy outdoors.  Our service was very attentive and THOSE VIEWS, just wow.  We had a party of 4 and everyone enjoyed it.  We tried the alligator for an appetizer,  yummy.  I will most definitely be back.

On a mini vacation with my man. Came here for a quick bite to eat and some beers to start off our trip. Definitely didn't disappoint! Excellent food. Bartender (Frank I think!!) was awesome! We sat at the outside bar. He was very sweet. Answered all our questions regarding the local beers and local hot spots. Very attentive. Great spot to watch the sunset also!!!! We got there around 6 and we had an excellent view of the water with the sun setting over it. Def a nice chill spot. Weekends are definitely more lively. We went on a Monday and it still wasn't dead. Great Tampa spot. So happy we stopped!!!!

My friend and I had lunch here and the food was ok. The problem started when we asked for separate checks and we each gave our credit cards to the waiter. When he came back to the table he informs my friend that their registers will not take a card without a chip and that she needs to use their ATM to get cash for payment. When I received my statement I saw where he charged me for her lunch and he took her cash! Basically gave himself a $32 tip. When we took our receipts back to the manager he literally said "This waiter has been here a long time and gets confused with credit cards and he didn't mean to do it"  What? Beware and check your credit card statements if you go here.

Be careful when buying specialty drinks. Server doesn't tell you price and when your bill comes you're suddenly paying $30 for one drink. Even though I tripled checked the price with my server. Bill came out way more than expected. Also rude about it.

Wow the other reviews are right! The foods is horrible especially on the outside bar area. The grouper sandwich was soooo bland and expensive. The fish tacos had 1 piece of fish in each shell. The fish tacos should be called coleslaw tacos because they were just filled with shredded lettuce and cans of corn and a sardine sized completely over salted fish.I didn't even eat the tacos after 2 bites and my husband forced down the bland grouper sandwich. Althogether the hossible meal and 1 pitcher of beer came up to 50 bucks SMH! Also we ordered a pitcher of corona and we swear it wasn't corona that they gave us but like a coors or miller.

Went there for lunch. Poor service. Amy behind the bar should quit. Walked past my empty glass 10 times with out looking to see its empty. She said I should say something, I told her she is the bartender and the place is dead so I shouldn't have to say anything. But the regulars beside me were getting asked every 5 min if they were good by 3 different people. Even after she rolled her eyes at me I still tipped 5 on 16. She is past her prime and tries way to hard to look good to the point it's sickening. And as another review says, porky girls that wear way short shorts with nothing but cellulite hanging out and pulling them out and down to cover while seating people then handding them menu's after pulling it out of her crotch.

I travel a lot for work and these are the best wings that I have ever had by far. I am not crazy about the south but boy, you sure can't beat the food! I had the Buffalo and the jerk wings. I couldn't get enough! Service was great and other foods were really good too. If my travels bring me to Tampa again, this is definitely a must go to.

It was ok.. probably won't be back. We were craving a grouper sandwich and it was nothing special. Plenty of other places with better grouper sandwiches. Also had a frozen daiquiri that was basic just like every where else. The server was sort of awkward too. Probably his first serving job.

Whiskey Joe's is an amazing restaurant! I truly enjoyed myself! Whiskey Joe's is located right on the water and offers great views! The food and drinks were great! The food came out fast and hot! Pictures speak for themselves please take a look to get a better idea. I ordered the Jamaican Whitefish and my wife ordered the Swashbuckler Basket! We also tried the firecracker shrimp and the fried gator with fried pickles. Whiskey Joe's has great customer service. They even offer valet parking. Definitely recommend giving this place a shot and take 1 while you're at. ;-)
The firecracker shrimp tacos were delicious!! Love the seasoning on the tortilla chips! Will definitely come back.

Atmosphere is wonderful, but don't go for the food, at least not for anything blackened - cook does not know the difference between blackened fish and poached fish.  Bleh, sent it back and he sent it right back out as it was.  Seriously??? We usually take company here when they come to visit - looking for a new place!

OUCH - Valet guys were total jerks - was supposed to have another lunch meeting there this week but cancelled reservations and won't be back again with the way the valet guys handled themselves. This is even before getting in the door for a mediocre meal.....
Excellent service, view and food. Pile of nachos was so big, we were satisfied eating that and our side salads. Priced right , We will definitely be back.

Dang. Really regret not listening to other reviewers 
My bf and I just left there after speaking to the manager. He comped our meal. 
First off, the staff wasn't sure what was on the menu if u ate outside as opposed to inside. We went to see a reggae band play and sat outside which seemed nice enough but I ordered water and wanted to look at the beer list, 20 mins later the server came back and I ordered a beer then she came back that it wasn't available. We ordered food which had all the wrong toppings not to mention it was gross. We got shrimp and sausage quesadillas but they were salad shrimp and what tasted like hot dog! quesadillas. They came w a chipotle mayo which was hot. Like warm, like warmer than room temp. We also ordered steak tacos w the chimichurri sauce on the side. The sauce was on the side and the coleslaw which was bitter! The "carne asada" was dried out meat. So it was literally meat on a tortilla. Nothing else. No lettuce, tom, chz. Dry. Granted we didn't want their sauce. We got none of the house made salsa which was supposed to come with it. We couldn't wait to get out of there and will NEVER be going back. There's more I could write but I'm at my next destination.

We were suppose to drive to clearwater beach and saw this place from the road so we decided to stop. Best decision we ever made. It was the first of many. There's a beach here so bring your swimsuit. The food is great and the drinks are awesome. The service is great as well.

Friday evening Parking was decent Got a great table with a view! Ordered artichoke and crab dip! Woof! The. The chips tasted like I was eating an ashtray! Next! Ok I ordered the chopped salad! If you don't like spicy or cayenne pepper Don't order the salad or ask to omit it! I couldn't even eat it But the waitress took it off the bill for us! Food was so so But views were great, if that makes up for the food quality I am not sure!

OVERRATED... Ok, don't get me wrong... It probably gets tons of visitors because of it's location with a view but folks possibly can't be going here for the service and the food. Customer service was super slow and they were not even busy. Food, well nothing to write home about. I asked what people at there, bartender recommended the Grouper Sandwich or tacos... We I wasn't coming all the way to Florida for tacos when I get the real deal in Cali... That Grouper Sandwich was sad... Super dry, pitiful portion of fish served with a HUGE bun. Fries were decent but I'm not trying to come just for the fries. As for the bar... Well all the specialty drinks come out of a margarita machine and had a 711 Slurpee texture... All the alcohol must've been left in the machine cause it was WEAK! Oh, and that bar had tons of bugs flying around as well... Won't be back.

Wow, just left here. All parking at bar is now valet, dude came running after us to let us know. Only other parking is beach parking which you will also pay for. We live in Ft. Myers and loved this place, but I think I'll find other places to love now. Paying for the "pleasure" of eating at your establishment is just not my thing. A little like being held hostage,don't ya think? It is 5:00 p.m. on a Monday night, snowbird season over. Seriously??? 

Just recieved an answer to the above review that explained the parking situation better. Wish the guy who chased after us would have explained this to us, so I have changed my review to reflect that I am the one who misunderstood. We love this restaurant, food is great and ambiance is fun. Now that I know I can park there, all is right with the world. A big thank-you to Whiskey Joe's for caring enough to respond.

ATMOSPHERE: This place is right on the water so the views are great! We sat inside because it was a little chilly. There are fire pits on the beach you can sit around. I don't know if they have food service out there though. They also have a deck over the water but of course it was super crowded. Inside, the place is a little dark, but cozy. There are nice small aquariums around to make you feel like you're at the beach. Also, there are some nice places to walk along the beach after dinner. You don't even need to move the car! They have valet, too. 

CUSTOMER SERVICE: Customer service is just okay. Our waitress was obviously upset to be working on her birthday, she even mentioned it a few times. But never the less, she kept a smile. They were nice but didn't really have good customer service skills. Our drinks were never refilled the whole time but they never hesitated to sell you on alcohol. We were here for about TWO hours, just to eat dinner. We had a small mishap, but for not being very busy, our food took FOREVER. It took forever because they ask you what you want to drink. Then they bring that. Then once you've had a second to look at the drink menu, they take your alcohol order. Then that takes 15 minutes or so. Then they come back for your appetizer or food order. But it was a good 25 minutes after we sat down that we could finally order. Our food took about 45 minutes even tho it wasn't crowded. This leads me into the food. 

FOOD: I ordered the white sand pizza which is basically an Alfredo pizza with chicken, spinach, and artichokes. The pizza came and it seriously looked like a tortilla with Alfredo sauce. Thin crusted is a serious understatement. It was crunchy and fell apart pulling it apart. The pizza was so bland. I couldn't taste anything. The chicken tasted like frozen chicken and was perfectly grilled and sliced. Obviously from a frozen bag of chicken. So I ordered a burger. Man- this burger was delicious. It was just their signature burger. Definitely order it. I'm not even a big burger person but this one was amazing. Also, it doesn't matter what you order, make sure you order fries. I don't know what they do to make them so yummy! And I'm not a huge fan of coleslaw either but it came with the burger so I tried it. Gosh. Even that was delicious. My sister ordered the mac and cheese with crab and shrimp. That was okay. Crab was good but completely minced up to the point where we thought it was breadcrumbs. Also, the sauce for the mac and cheese was definitely out of a can or box. But other than that it was alright. We also ordered dessert. The cheesecakes were obviously bought elsewhere and not made in house. They don't have a desert menu so you just have to make a desision based on how your waiter describes it. Ours did a terrible job but we were craving sugar so we ordered the mud pie and cheesecake anyway. I absolutely hate coffee flavored chocolate. Our waitress just said it was a chocolate mousse pie. I feel like she had never even freaking SEEN it before. It was like a bag of Oreos had exploded over a piece of cheesecake. The cheesecake was NOT chocolate. I don't even know what it was supposed to be. But the crust was Oreo and it had like 10 Oreos smashed up over the entire plate. The worst part was that the whole thing tasted like coffee. Gross. Don't order the mud pie unless you like coffee flavored Oreos. 

We probably won't come back unless it's a nice day since the location is so nice.
Came in for happy hour w a group from the office. Can't beat the atmosphere and location on the water. Had drinks and appetizers and our waitress Amy did a great job. Recommend her and Whiskey Joes.

This place is perfect to watch the sunset and enjoy the evenings next to warm bonfire pits. The servers are sweet (most of the time) and they have peanuts to grab and snack on while waiting for your order. The only reason I didn't give this place 5-stars is because their food quality could definitely be better and fresher. If you're looking for the most bang for your buck, go during Happy Hour. From 4-7 pm they have kinds of amazing cocktails and for food; the nacho appetizer is Huge! Definitely big enough to split.

I always look forward to my yearly visit to Whiskey Joes.  The place is always busy.  Great food, good drinks.  Service can be hit or miss but lucked out this last time, sat in the bar area and had a great server.  It took a bit but once she got to our table it was fine. 
Great bay and sunset views!!!

I've been coming to whiskey joes for the past 5 years. The food is delicious. I love the seating area outside above the water. It's a breathtaking view and convenient bar up there. The outdoor beach bar area is always a blast!!! They have live music on certain nights and a great vibe. They should stop serving bottles in this area because I've ran across broken glass in the sand. The fire pits are wonderful this time of the year. This is a great Sunday fun day spot. The only thing I really really dislike is the lack of parking. Thank goodness for complimentary valet!!

We had dinner there shells and muscles was ok ,salmon i recommend. Services was a little Missy unorganized.
They have an amazing beach bar area and one of the best sunset spots a must see sunset.
Grateful for the view and the food had the coconut chicken and it was awesome. Would be back as soon as I return to the area

My 1st Time there, visiting from
Pittsburgh! It was alright!! I really liked our waitress, Tracey!! She was very personable & attentive!! Thank you for the Great Service!
Great ribs, cold beer and a friendly staff. That's about all you can ask for when a place is already sitting on the water so you can watch the sunset.

I don't even remember what sandwich I ordered. It was alright. But the fries! They were perfect. I would go there just for the fries.
We sat outside on the deck- very nice view.

Drinks are average. Staff is one of the worst I have experienced. Waited for an hour for food that the bartender never put in and ended up leaving because it would have taken over 2 hrs for nachos. I would not suggest this place to anyone who has any experience working in the service industry. To say the least in a city that bars like this are common, don't waste your time here.
A little touristy for my tastes.  Food is alright, but the main attraction is the view.  Love the outdoor seating.

If I could give zero stars I would. Seated for lunch on a Tuesday(today). Moderate crowd, no wait, two in our party. Seated for 15-20 min and no one ever came to our table. Nothing. Not even a "I'll be with you in a minute". We left, but stopped by the hostess area to let someone know. Get it together - that's Restaurant 101. Easy stuff. Won't be back. Of course.

I just had an awful experience here. I arrived with some family members and requested to sit outside. All the tables were taken but we were assured that we were the only ones waiting. We waited 30 minutes and three other families were seated ahead of us outside even though 3 of the employees all knew we were waiting. My wife told the hostess we were leaving because others were being seated outside ahead of us. Instead of apologizing she said that she was about to seat us and gave us a very sarcastic bye on the way out. Very disappointing :(
Horrible - don't bother - took a party of 7 3 1/2 hrs to complete our meal - worst service ever.  We had to get our own plates for our apps - server either too lazy or too stupid.

I am giving this 4 stars not for food but atmosphere.  Amazing!  Live music outside on the beach with gorgeous fire pits and a large bar outside.  I ordered a couple of appetizers and they were typical bar food but I was many really there to eat!  Great place great times!

This is my second time at Whiskey Joe's. 
First, I will say that the location and atmosphere is almost unbeatable. The service is awesome, too. We sat in the bar with the bartender, Scott, who is really great. Other servers and staff were also friendly and welcoming. As for the food, the shrimp tacos were so good the first time I came, I had to get them again. We also got the queso dip which was so tasty. Also- get the Skinny Margarita!!!! Will definitely return on our next visit to Tampa.

This place is one of my favorite happy hour hangouts in Tampa. It has one of the best sunset views in the city. They even have a private beach next to the restaurant with live music and a bar. It would be nice though for them to regularly clean the beach from plastic cups and beer cans. The outdoor sitting area is also very nice. The service is slow but ok.
The big drawback of this restaurant is its food.... If the owner would have better food quality and a better food menu, he/she would be a millionaire by now! It is almost a sin that they don't improve the food menu and the food quality. I only go to this place for drinks, and I would only ask for food if I'm desperately hungry.
Message to the owner - improve the food menu please!

Good beach bar and beach party atmosphere but the food I ordered was not very good. I ordered the fish tacos and the fish was tough and tasted very fishy. It doesn't tell you on the menu what the fish is and I should have asked before, but when I asked after they said it was pollock. For a Florida place on the water they should not go cheap and instead do Grouper. Especially since it's $12 for two tacos. Disappointed.

Great restaurant. I had the grouper sandwich which was execellant and the wife also enjoyed her jerked chicken sandwich. The waiter was very friendly and checked on us every two to three minutes. The view at this place is also excellent.
 
I would definitely recommend this place to all looking for a great dinner wiith a view

I went here about 5 years ago and I remembered it being good so I decided to try it again.  Ugh.  We sat down and not 1 person acknowledged us.  We waited about 15 mins to put in our drink order...we should've just left then.   We ordered 2 appetizers..and we were gonna order more but after waiting 30 mins to get chips with queso we couldn't believe our 2nd appetizer never came out.  The queso was cold, not melted at all so we just asked the waitress to pop it in the microwave for us real quick bc we were starving. We finished the chips and still no wings....she came back about 15 mins apologizing for the wait.  We are currently still here waiting for the wings(20 mins after we finished the I wish we could just get our check and leave.  I don't even want them anymore.


Updated----she came back after another 10 mins and said we were 3rd in line!  Ummm what?!?  We just got our check and left.  The place was NOT even busy.   Very bad service...such a shame bc the location is so pretty.  Hopefully it changes ownership again

This place gets a 5 for atmosphere and the sunset. I completely agree with the other reviewer who said the views make the average food taste better. But I'm not even going to write about the food. That's not why you go here.

If you're having a crappy day, this is where you need to come. I crashed my car about a year ago, came here, had two mango margaritas, watched the sunset, and I forgot all about my car. It  probably helped that the Tampa Bay Parrotheads were having a meetup and a bunch of drunk 50-somethings were doing a conga line through the restaurant. 

This is the best view of the sunset in Tampa. Sit out on the deck, grab a fancy drink, and brace yourself for the reason I moved to the West coast: the unbelievable sunset.

They also have a tiki bar on their "beach" with live music. The sand itself is kind of nasty, so it's best to keep your shoes on. If you can't make it for the sunset, the next best thing is to sit out at the beach bar on a nice day.

Slimy shrimp,slimy gritty oysters =this place sucks!!!

Way to EXPENSIVE.
I will never stop here again!!!

Came on a Saturday night with a large party and was told a 2 hour wait. They are a very busy place!! We went down to the beach and had some drinks until it was our turn for dinner. (You can also order food at the beach but is an abbreviated menu and we wanted the full menu). So two hours came and went and we went to check on the status and were told 2 more hours wait. Well sorry that wasn't going to work for me, double the wait time we were told. So I asked to talk to a manager since our party patiently waited 2 hours. All was solved when they offered our party the private room that is usually rented out! We got to all dine in the private room for free which I really appreciated! After that the food and drinks were amazing! I don't remember what I had to drink but I had the quesadilla and mussel appetizers, they were good and everyone else was also satisfied with their food. Thank you for accommodating us!

Invited by a friend to just chill and relax!  Sat outside and had a great view of the water the problem is that it's too hot! My suggestion is for them to put a fan outside!
