Nevertheless the food was good I ordered the new England clam chowder,  and the gator bites! And had a Margarita drinks! Just nice to have a drink sit outside and enjoy the view!

My first time to visit this place and will come and visit again to try some other dish that they have!

I live very close and should be a regular but I'm not because I consistently get terrible service. I was a bartender for 15 years so I'm always patient and friendly with bartenders and staff. One bartender in particular always has a scowl on her face. They act like you're bothering them when you order a drink. I've even tipped great hoping they'd change their attitude but it's the same every time so I frequent Bahama Breeze where the bartenders are quick and friendly.  This opinion is mostly for the bar outside on the sand. It's a shame because the location is great. I haven't been there in about 6 months but I've been going there for 6 years and it's been the same.

At first, we were going to go to a restaurant across the street at 5pm on a Sat. When we arrived we were told the wait time for a party of 5 adults 2 kids and a baby was at least 90 minutes. I called Whiskey Joe's and spoke to the manager Nick who informed me that he could throw some tables together for us and fit us in that very minute. We drove right over and the place was packed and on a wait. True to his word Nick had us sat right away and we had an amazing meal and a fantastic time. I can not recommend this place enough and will definitely be back purely for the service we received.
Ps. The carnitas were amazing.

The view is great.  But everything else is average at best.  The food is typical beachy, touristy, bar food.  As for the drinks...they were out of three beers that we wanted.  The Coronorita we finally received tasted like orange juice, the cocktails barely had any alcohol, and the limes for our cervezas were all dried out.  This list makes us sound like alcoholics, but we sent back the coronarita, only had one beer, and there was no alcohol in the mixed drinks...

It was ok. My husband and I split a big kahuna pizza and a whisky burger in paradise for our meal and ordered the gator bites for an appetizer. The pizza was pretty good but it was a little dry.  The gator bites were tasty and cooked well. The burger sucked. We ordered it medium and it was well done and dry. The grilled pineapple was canned tidbits. Come here for the drinks. The outdoor bar is fun, right on the water and reasonably priced.
Whiskey Joe's is good. Typical bar with typical barfood. I wouldn't trust the oysters unless it's a "R" month who knows where they get them from.

Right off the bat I knew I would like the menu at Whiskey Joe's solely based on their drink selections! The mojitos were absolutely delicious and refreshing while we sat on the second story patio overlooking the bay. The food went above what you'd expect from a seaside bar & grille. Definitely get the mussels! The view itself is worth every penny.

After lunch we mozied down to the beachside tiki bar where you could lay in lounge chairs, sit under a tiki umbrella, play cornhole, swim, etc. This spot was really cool! I would definitely recommend Whiskey Joe's!

Went on a Saturday afternoon, view and food were good. Either you have to valet or pay to park on the adjacent lot. Knocked a star off as we waited for a bout 15 minutes after we sat down for someone to give us a menu and take a drink order and they were not at all busy.

As others have said, great location... fantastic view and beach setting... food is good for a bar and grill... only to have it all ruined by just abysmal service at the tiki bar beach area. 

I sat at a high top table on the beach area, and never once had a server come to the table. Not. One. Time. So after waiting for about 20 minutes, I continued to walk up to the bar to order each drink. And then to order dinner about 45 or so minutes after sitting there with drinks. I ordered a burger, which was very good, but was told to come back up to the bar in "about 10 minutes" to pick it up. Confused by the service procedure, as I was sitting at a high top not 10 steps from the the bar with two wait-staffers walking right passed me literally the entire time I sat there, I obliged. Walked back, set a timer on my phone for 10 minutes, and waited. Alarm goes off, I walk up to the bar again, "oh, I guess it's not ready yet it'll be just a few more minutes." She says. I told her  "no problem, I'll just keep walking back up to the bar every few minutes to check and see if it's ready." "Okay!" She says... more confused than ever, I ask, "do you guys have wait staff for the beach table areas?" ... "yeah, there should be somebody out there." She says. Confused as could possibly be and starting to get pretty fed up, I walk back to my table and set a timer for 10 more minutes, walked back to the bar, the burger was ready and had been sitting on the counter behind the bar waiting for me to come back and pick it up. Picked it up, took it back to the table, ate, walked back to the bar to pay and left. 

I must say, everyone at the bar I interacted with was very friendly when you got their attention, they just seemed incredibly oblivious to anything that was going on until you got their attention. It was honestly a truly mind boggling restaurant experience. 

I would say it is worth stopping in and trying it out, as the view and beach atmosphere truly is amazing. Just be prepared to be incredibly patient, confused, and do most of the service work yourself.

My fiancé and I were looking for a relaxed place to grab a quick seaside bite before checking into our hotel, and he has always wanted to try Whiskey Joes. The parking lot was a disaster, but we happened to snag a close spot. No problem getting an outside table (was a Sunday around 6:30 pm in March). Great! Quick seating. However, once seated the atmosphere was dirty and we were underwhelmed. There are tables overlooking the water, but we moved to one under the bar roof area bc it was windy and cold, and afraid it was about to rain. It took FOREVER to get our food, and it wasn't that busy. The food was similar to a chain such as Applebee's. I ordered the mussels, and the sauce was way too salty and buttery. My fiancés shrimp tacos were average. Dirty floors with trash and food on them. The only good thing was that the servers were very nice. Won't be coming back though.

This is one of those places that always seems to have a full parking lot when I drive by, which generally speaks well of a place. When I stopped by last week the parking lot was packed as usual, but people were starting to leave since the dinner rush was over, so I was able to get a seat out on the deck immediately. The sun had set, but I could tell from what was left in the sky that it had been a spectacular view. There's also a little beach park right near the outside deck. I'm guessing the beach and the view of the bay (and perhaps the bar, which seemed like it could get hoppin') are the reasons the parking lot gets packed, because the food was very disappointing. 
It's hard to judge a place based on one meal, but I picked a few relatively simple items and what came out to my table was pretty unappetizing. The "world famous" fries are a step or two below McDonalds', the Ahi Tuna sliders had just a tiny piece of tuna and the Hawaiian bun hadn't been grilled like it was advertised, etc. 

I can see going back to watch the sun set and have a couple drinks sometime, but probably not if I'm hungry.

Very nice restaurant and awesome water front 
But the worse SERVICE  ever and food mediocre to say at best.
If I could I would give it -5  for the really poor service provided for their customers.

I have been here 4 times for me to go to the same place 4 times when there are so many different resturants to visit they are doing something right! I always get the shrimp and oysters as an appetizer it is wonderful the shrimp are huge and the oysters clean (cocktail sauce horseradish and lemon) FRESH!!!!! I have had the pirate's chest or fisherman's chest (i forget what they call it)it's all of the fried seafood fried fish, scallops shrimp, delicious with fries Krispy and fresh.  The waitress suggested the fish tacos I never had fish tacos before 1st time I ever tried them it was fresh! it was delicious  and fresh.  I have since tried other places and they did not measure up to the ones I had at Whiskey Joes  I will go back there again just for those . the scenery is beautiful the drinks are on point the staff are friendly and kind and very accommodating.  You May wait a little bit but it's worth it at-least check them out once and besides the patio and the inside bar there is a beach side haven't been there yet but I hear there are fire pits and it is fun I will be checking that out soon too!

I was excited it seemed cool but I sat at the bar outside for about 3-5 min and saw 2 girls behind the bar and I understand when someone is busy but they walked by me a dozen times and not even a hi or I'll be right with you or anything. Then they asked the guys next to me if they wanted to order food... hmmmm. I must be invincible. After sitting for a while left. What a bummer. Off to the next bar instead.

Food was okay. We had to sit inside because of the weather and the place smelled like urine, badly. Service could of been more attentive. We had our son with us and it took about 10 minutes to get drinks on the table and she took about another 10 minutes to check on us after we received our meal. Only good thing about this place is the view and valet.

Beautiful views. Horrible service. Average food. Go for some drinks hang out with some friends watch the sunset. And don't expect anything else. Tried it three separate times over a year every time I got ignored and had bad service.

Whiskey Joe's has a beachy atmosphere and great view, however their food is average. I had the grouper sandwich during my last visit and it tasted pretty fishy. Their tiki beach is a cool place to hang out and have a drink though.

The tiki bar has a great location and is one of my favorite places to grab a drink near the water.  Downside is service is typically pretty bad and the food outside at the tiki bar is mediocre at best. Come to drink near the water and people watch but expect to wait for drinks and eat elsewhere.

I went here during the 4th of july weekend and this place was definitely packed!  The views are amazing and the drinks were good.  I had this cucumber margarita drink with jalapenos which sounds really weird but it was quite refreshing.  The shrimp tacos were really good but the fries had too much seasoning on them.  We had to send them back because the salt overload was too much.  The second batch was good.  Our waiter was cool too... i forgot his name but he was super nice. I would definitely go back...

Once again because my son who is in love with the coconut rum wings, we were back at Whiskey Joe's to further explore the menu.  We started with the so addictive wings, since hubby is out of town for business we decided to enjoy a little mom and son time with a good meal.  I decided to order the strictly off the appetizer section on the menu because I notice a few eye catching dishes that caught my last time and I was was happy with both choices and my son ordered mac and cheese with grilled shrimp added.

My appetizer choices consisted of shrimp &  sausage quesadilla and Joe's Rocking Oysters. The oysters were filled a great cornbread stuffing that was filled with corn, andouille sausage, crabmeat and pepper jack cheese, I could barely taste the crab, but the freshness of the oysters was excellent and the overall taste of the dish was delicious just wish I could of tasted a little more crab.  The shrimp & sausage quesadilla was full of flavor and I would definitely order both appetizers again.  My son was like mom this mac and cheese is great next time I want to add crab to it to kick it up another notch (yes we watch food network together lo) but seriously everytime we come to Whiskeys Joe's the service is great, our food is fresh and we are never disappointed.   We had an awesome time.

It did seem like we waited a while between ordering our drinks and appetizer and actually ordering the food, but other than that it was great! We had the Red Rum Runner and a Corona to start off with, followed by the Rocking Oysters (our favorite oysters so far), regular raw oysters, and the Eggplant Crab Stack salad. Everything was delicious and besides that one long 'break' our service was great, too! We would recommend. :)
asked for medium well not burnt on burger but burger was very burnt. fries were greasy. service was lousy. waiter seemed very scattered & lost. girls at hostess station were uppity and rude.

Pretty view but two fish tacos, a bowl of mac and cheese and two cokes are just not good enough to rack up a $45 tab for lunch. This is my second visit and probably last. Food just doesn't deserve the price.
The food was like fast food. We asked for medium well they give use extra well done. The tacos were ok

Great view. Great food. 
Fun place to eat. 
Good local Grouper.
The Price was not the best value. I guess it is expected given the view. 
Shelby is an amazing server. 
I will be back agin when in town.

I have been to Whiskey Joe's twice before, the first time I went my experience was good. The food and drinks were good, the outside atmosphere you couldn't beat! However, I went last night HORRIBLE service, we sat at the outside bar for 15min trying to get one of the bartenders attention. There were three bartenders working at the time, none of them bothered to look our way. It was almost as if they didn't want to serve us, they were busy closing up. Even though it wasn't  closing time! It was a Monday night at 9:45pm and we couldn't get any service. We ended up leaving, 100% will not return.
Awesome bar and great service on the bay! Grab a drink and a seat under an umbrella then enjoy!

We love Whiskey Joe's. They have an awesome beach that you can play bags on or have a fire or just hang out by the water. The drinks are amazing. Perfect amount of strong without even tasting the alcohol. They have my favorite wings ever which are the Coconut rum glazed wings. I could eat them everyday.
The food, & service is Awesome!! Great atmosphere next to the beach!! I recommend this place to all!!

I really enjoyed our evening at Whiskey Joe's. We came here to meet up with an old friend that lives in the Tampa area. Their parking lot is far too small for the amount of people that come here but you can use the beach parking next door for $1 but keep in mind it closes at 9PM (move your car before then!). 

Whiskey Joe's has a beach bar where you can sit by the gulf and drink your worries away. They also have plenty of seating indoors, as well as an outdoor deck area. We grabbed a table inside by the bar since everything else was an 1+ hour wait on a Wednesday night. The drinks are good but not very strong (I had a mojito). The food is actually delicious. My coconut chicken was perfect with the right balance of flavors.

Something funny happened while we were visiting. The power went out and popped right back on. They must have everything backed up (smart) since they never lost our tab. But the music and TVs took a while to reboot. Not sure how often this happens. Still a great place to visit.

Totally recommend if you don't know what you're in the mood for, their seafood is great! (I'm very picky with seafood) as well as their meats and pastas. 

Waiting time- at first we were going to sit outside in the sand area but the band was playing and it was too loud for our liking. So we opted in for inside where it was nice and cool. 

Staff- Our waitress was Sara and in training, Brandon. Both lovely people, and really friendly! 
They didn't make us wait long at all or forget about us. We were actually lucky to have two servers, they worked well as a team and did everything quickly and efficiently. Sara was super nice and let me order a smaller portion of the Mac and cheese since I only wanted a small side order with my food. 

Waiting time for food- Apps - we ordered two apps and they took about 10-15 min. The queso and chips were great! Also recommend the guacamole on the side 
     -Entrees- right after we were finished with the apps the main entrees came right away (all at the same time) 
The food was hot! Which is good because that means it wasn't out sitting. I ordered the swashbuckler basket, it's all FRIED. It was very tasty, I couldn't finish it, it was a lot of food. The Mac and cheese is SO GOOD! 
*we didn't order any desserts because we were way too full. 

*overall it was a great experience, friendly staff all around, great food, seating is great, and awesome location!

Drinks are average. Staff is one of the worst I have experienced. Waited for an hour for food that the bartender never put in and ended up leaving because it would have taken over 2 hrs for nachos. I would not suggest this place to anyone who has any experience working in the service industry. To say the least in a city that bars like this are common, don't waste your time here.

Visiting on a work trip and this has been my favorite spot. Great environment on the patio and the barefoot bar. The chicken Alfredo and pepperoni pizza were in the top ten best I've had. Has been live music each time I've been, even on the weekdays. If you're in the area you have to check it out.

Beautiful view, food is good, have great beer variety even ballast point on draft. The music was ok, good when they played Caribbean/reggae but than they had some country in between...doesn't go good with beach. Very friendly staff.

Nice environment, friendly staff. Food was just ok and was expensive. I dont think it was the chefs fault. I just think they are trying to pump out too much food so the quality and recipes weren't there. 

I give their ranch a 2 out of 5 stars.

Just the vibe me and my family were looking! We really enjoyed our visit to this beach front funky restaurant! Valet parking is only $5 bucks and the servers were amazing ! Everything on the menu looked amazing, I was even checking out other customer meals as they were coming out haha. I ordered the swashbuckler basket and was blown away with the fried scallops and the whitefish! I also had two margaritas made to perfection ! Next time me and my family are in Tampa, Whiskey Joe's will be the move !
Pricey tourist type of trap.  Seafood was fresh.  Meals very pricey.  Beautiful setting on the Bay.

Visited here last Sunday while they hosted a Steelers fan get together. I don't watch much football, but had friends in town so I decided to go with them. I had been to whiskey joes in the past and this was actually a better experience than the past. 

This is actually somewhat of a hard review. If I were to strictly rate the venue it was a good experience. The bar tenders and wait staff were fast and friendly. The line to get in moved quickly. I had been here a few years ago and I don't remember them having police officers so I felt this was a good addition. The dj and reggae band were both good.

The crowd is the biggest drawback. Since I went to a Steelers party I actually think the crowd was a good mix of people, but this does not seem to be their typical crowd. It's still a bit interesting in the fact that you will see girls dressed like they are going to a nightclub walking around with their two year old son... I think this is more of the "regular" crowd this place attracts. If you are going to people watch maybe a good place, but not exactly my scene.
Whiskey joes use to be good but then it turned into chain restaurant like food. I also got shit on by pigeon and the deck was too windy
Good basic beach bar. Decent food. Cold beer. Can sit on the beach, patio or indoors. Good time place. A step above your chain restaurants.

I went here about 5 years ago and I remembered it being good so I decided to try it again.  Ugh.  We sat down and not 1 person acknowledged us.  We waited about 15 mins to put in our drink order...we should've just left then.   We ordered 2 appetizers..and we were gonna order more but after waiting 30 mins to get chips with queso we couldn't believe our 2nd appetizer never came out.  The queso was cold, not melted at all so we just asked the waitress to pop it in the microwave for us real quick bc we were starving. We finished the chips and still no wings....she came back about 15 mins apologizing for the wait.  We are currently still here waiting for the wings(20 mins after we finished the chips) I wish we could just get our check and leave.  I don't even want them anymore.
Cute beach side bar.  Came for Gator Bites.   I got the steamed clams.   They are yummy
Met friends reuniting after 15 years...great service (thanks Neil), great food and a really beautiful sunset. Go...enjoy and reconnect!
*horrible service*  we ate outdoors and the waitress took foooorrrr evvveeerrr!  The drinks are small for what you pay and the food wasnt that great.  Not recommending this to anyone.

Every year we come to Clearwater Beach for vacation. After we land at TPA we take a short ride to Whisky Joe's for our first Florida meal. You'll read that parking here can be a problem, you usually have to use their valet service. However, once you get over that it's all up hill from there. This year we started with the simple chips and queso appetizer. There was a hearty fill of queso and the waitress was nice enough to give us extra chips so we could finish it all. The drinks are a little pricy but they're not terrible. The food and atmosphere is what we love. The staff is always friendly and helpful from the hostess to the waitstaff.  This year I ordered the fried grouper sandwich. When the plate arrived I was stunned to see the large filet of grouper sticking out the side of the bun. I didn't expect that much fish on one sandwich! It was of course tasty and came with well seasoned fries. A great way to start our vacation as usual!

Went for Happy Hour. Drinks were good, service was good. I ordered the Carnitas which was delicious and plentiful for the price. Sitting out in the deck gives you a beautiful view of the sunset. Afterward we moved out to one of the fire pits on the beach. Overall the restaurant can be described as "chainy" so don't expect anything gourmet but for what it is, it's decent. Worth it just for the view of the sunset.

It was our first experience after our flight landed. We had heard great reviews on google and yelp so we determined to check it out ourselves. We had dinner right on the beach at the Tiki Bar. As the sunset went down the view was unexplainable. The bar staff Courtney and Caroline where we sat before we took our table were extraordinary in customer service.Their personality along with the Florida sun made us feel like we were on an island getaway. After being seated at one of the eleven Tiki Tables on the beach  we were introduced to Jennifer  and Alex our wait staff. They were pleasant, attentive and comical. As a whole I would rate Whiskey Joes a  in the sand environment with phenomenal customer service. I also might add while we were enjoying our dinner we walked upstairs to catch the sunset from the second deck. The bartender staff on had Julie and Marquise were super friendly as well while we savored the brief moment of the Florida sunset.
Super fun family lunch! Grouper was really good and the drinks were fabulous! Nothing beats the view or the service! Can't wait to bring my family here when they come into town!

This is truly one of the worst restaurants in Tampa, you are paying for a view. The food is mostly terrible, with a couple exceptions and is waaaay overpriced. Spend the extra 30 minutes and go to the rep beaches in Clearwater and St. Pete. I went there on my 30th birthday, the plumbing was not working and I discovered the restaurant did not have a microwave...They never really have any specials other than a happy hour (weak drinks) and their live bands were so bad they actually made us laugh.

I'm giving this restaurant a 5* because of Jamie, our server. 
On March 7 I was taking family to the airport & we stopped in for an early dinner. 
The food was great (4*) but Jamie did all she could to make it better. 
I ordered crab cakes from the appetizer menu. They came with a hot sauce which I didn't want. Jamie recommended a tartar sauce or the remoulade which was perfect. 
My sister had the Squash Buckler Basket (seafood, fries & cole slaw). 
Her husband had the Strawberry Guava Ribs w/fries & slaw. Jamie was a hit with him making suggestions for different beers he wanted to try. 
I also had a basket of fries which was enough for 4 people!!!
We had a window seat & watched the people zipping by on water crafts. It was too windy to sit outdoors. So the ambiance was great. 
Jamie took great care of us, so I hope you get her as a server or someone equally as terrific. 
We really enjoyed this experience & will repeat it soon I hope.

The things they can't control are their best qualities: beach, weather, people watching. As for their food, drinks and service; horrible. Bland and inconsistent food, drinks are fine, and service is their weakest point. I actually waited 20 minutes to for a drink and eventually gave up after being continually ignored by their servers. I haven't received quick service to date and have finally gave up on this place. Worst. Service . Ever.

This place has a nice outdoor area. There are opportunities for improvements in food. The crab cakes I ordered where less than 3 oz. for an order and mostly breading. The price for them was over what it should be. On forth of July they had an old classic rock band.. which was okay but then they had some blinding light show that was horrendous. I don't think it's even legal as it literally was like lasers reaching across to the adjacent buildings. Hopefully given this place's location some improvements can be made.

I was not happy at all. I'm a foodie so I'll give anything a try. I should have know to turn away based off the other reviews. I'm in town for the weekend and my hotel is next door. I went to whisky joes and was served soggy fried fish. Not only was my fish was soggy but so was my friends. We order the Jamaican White fish. The batter wasn't cooked all the way.  Our server was polite. I can't fault him for the cooks action but for that they are getting 2 stars.
Live band music is very good today! Lots of people celebrating Labor Day weekend!  Party on!

I've been to this place several times and always enjoyed it. So this Sunday I had friends in town and suggested we spend the day here. Although coming on a Sunday was a massive mistake. The beach part we were all so excited about was covered with armed security guards which made all of us uncomfortable. As a few more minutes passed the air was full with marijuana smoke. We also saw more underwear than we felt comfortable seeing trying to eat. I am leaving this review for anyone that does not enjoy loud rap music, weed smoke, and underwear to AVOID THIS PLACE ON A SUNDAY!

My husband and I joined some friends here and really enjoyed ourselves. The drinks were really good and I loved the atmosphere. I would like to come during the day to see the beach in daylight as well. The food was great and big portions. My husband had Alfredo and I had pizza. My only complaint the night we went is there was some big concert event so we had to do valet parking and we didn't have cash so there was a bit of a hassle trying to get cash from a friend and then paying them back later. However overall a good experience and we will definitely be back.

This is my #1 spot. I am able to sit close to the water and have some awesome drinks without having to drive an hour to st.pete waterfront.

food is good drinks are great. staff can be a bit nicer, but it is always busy so they do what they can.

Check this place out whenever you want to kick back toes in the sand.

The food's nothing special but the setting is nice.  It's really nice to sit outside on the beach where the bartenders are the best servers in the establishment.  We had typical beach bar drinks, my mojito was fine, grouper sandwich was okay, made for a nice few hours hanging around without any work to do.  It's much better to arrive just as they open, the crowd doesn't come until just after noon and long before then we had the best seats at the bar.  This has to be the most child friendly bar (the outside, "barefoot bar" part) in town.  I feel sorry for the wait-staff hopping the tables in the sand, a workout with platters of food and drink with small fast moving obstacles (i.e. children) in the sun, and yet I couldn't help notice some cheap tipping going on around me.  I don't know why anyone would choose indoors on a nice day.

One star is really pushing it. And I mean really pushing it. So came during dinner rush on a Saturday 2/25/2017 and fully expecting it to be busy since my girlfriend and I both are in the service industry. 45 minute wait for a table no big deal. 

Here's where the terrible, just horrific service began. 

Seated at 7:06, wasn't greeted by either bartender on the patio for ten minutes. Keep in mind the dinner rush was dying. Finally after being greeted we ordered food, nachos and ribs. Both foods if you aren't aware, are already are precooked and half to be heated in the oven, nacho toppings are scoop and serve. 

Our "server" didn't come back to check on us once. So 40 minutes later our food finally comes out, cold. It's been dead in the window for a minimum of 15 minutes, guacamole and sour cream are both warm, the fries and ribs were cold and the barbecue sauce had turned into a glaze. During the period where the food came out, we had already talked to the manager who was more than understanding. Comped the meal and told my girlfriend he would get new food out. Our server was made aware by the manager to comp the meal. And the kicker is, we waited ANOTHER 30 MINUTES WHEN IT WAS DEAD ONLY TO BE TOLD THERE WAS "a miscommunication and that the food would be out shortly. " 

So in ending, terrible absolutely miserable service in a post dinner rush establishment is absolutely unacceptable, just terrible all around. Servers and bartenders need better training and "communication" and checking on tables/greeting tables should be brought up in your staff meetings. Food for thought.
Amazing location! On the beach bar and Tikki huts with fire pits.

This place needs a serious management overhaul as well as serving staff.  How it has even managed with three stars is beyond me. Have waited almost 15 minutes without seeing a single server to approach the table. Have only been to this place once and that was for an event, came a second time for the sunset and the nachos which I felt were pretty good the first time. I would love to review that but I haven't had the opportunity to order yet, nachos...!!! That's all I have come here for and it's taking almost 20 minutes to be seen. Quite honestly I wouldn't recommend this place unless you go to the bar and order which was actually pretty prompt.  The service however...I've gotten better service at a red robin.
What a great location. Original mojitos on the beach. Great service ... especially from our rocking waitress Noah. Gator bites were tasty. Jerk wings were outstanding! A definite must-visit in Tampa.

This is my first-stop Go-To place when friends or family come in from out of town and are hungry and thirsty right off the plane. It's a hop and skip from TPA. Sitting on the deck or at a bar-top table with a couple of boat drinks and a good burger while watching the sun dip over the Bay sets the tone for their whole visit. If it is the middle of the day the wait staff will leave you alone to catch up and plan. The beer selection is limited and basic ... which by local standards means a couple of local drafts along with a solid drink menu. Stick to the bar food basics and you cannot go wrong.

BIG WARNINGS ABOUT THIS PLACE!!!!!!

I actually don't know how this place passes their inspections by the health department.  Walking up to the entrance it had a strong odor of horse crap.  It only got worse as I went in and had a drink at the bar while waiting for my group.  The place smelled like an out house.  I was at the inside bar and felt like I was at an outside picknic with all the flies that were inside.

Bar service- the girl with the piercings and tattoo's was very good and kept control of the orders coming in.  I do have a issue with the two other employees hanging out behind the bar eating their dinners.  Can't they go somewhere else?  I wouldn't dare ask them for something to disturb their meals.

When they were done, they didn't even take their plates and containers away.  The bartender was prepping mint leaves and pouring beer right over the fly filled leftover plates.  

I saw servers walking around playing with their long hair.  The girls eating behind the bar didn't wash their hands before going back on the floor.  One turned the faucet on and let her hands touch the water, but no soap.  Another male server picked up someone's blended drink from the bar.  He put in on his tray and they licked his fingers and said yum.  Then proceeded to put lime wedges in other drinks.

I found it strange that the bar prepped about 30 mojitos before anyone even ordered them.  Yes, the put the lime, mint and some type of syrup into all the classes and then stuck them under the bar until someone would order one.  Keep in mind- there are flies EVERYWHERE.

On to dinner- we had a large private party.  We have come month after month for about 6 or 7 months and have had the exact same food in the buffet.  None of it has been all that great in the past, but edible.  Well this visit was much different!  They brought out a tray of about 30 chicken breasts (jamaican jerk) and every single piece was completely raw!  The waitress was walking around telling everyone not to eat the chicken.  It was slightly dark so some people had some of the chicken because they couldn't see it.  The plantains tasted like they were cooked last week.

The manager tried to accomodate and change out the items for fries and beans.  However, that diidn't change the fact that this place is nasty.  If their kitchen runs anything like the rest of the place does, this place should be closed.

Hubs always wants seafood, and since this restaurant in Rocky Point isn't far from our house, we decided to try it for dinner on a Friday night in late October. I signed up for their loyalty club & was delighted to immediately receive an e-coupon for a free appetizer. We also browsed their menu online before leaving home, so we knew what we wanted. Given their location, I expected so much more from Whiskey Joe's. Unfortunately, I was disappointed.

We used Open Table within the Yelp app to reserve a table. This was my first time using that feature, and it was easy-peasy. Although, when I tried to make an account afterward via my Google creds, an error stated I'd already made a reservation with the same Gmail. Uhm, that's correct, so what's the problem? Anyway, I digress... We were immediately seated after choosing where to sit: inside or on the patio. But neither the deck nor inside were busy at 8:30 on a Friday night, so the reservation was moot. 

I'll specifically mention that our hostess was incredibly accommodating. When hubs didn't like the patio table she led us to first, she quickly brought us to a table inside near the bar. And she told us we were free to move to a empty window table once those nearby had been bussed. She even came back a few minutes later to let us know she'd found a bus boy to clean off any table we wanted. (No explanation why so many empty tables hadn't been cleared). Ultimately, we decided to stay at the table close to the bar so we could watch Game 3 of the World Series & Navy vs USF. 

We found drinks to be a bit pricey. At $9 & $10 for nearly every mixed drink, we opted to get a Bud Light pitcher for $10.70. It was actually a fairly large pitcher, with at least 4 full drinks! However, we were given thick plastic glasses, which seemed cheap. Hubs asked the bartender that brought the pitcher if he had any chilled glasses, and the guy rudely replied he'd just taken these plastic cups out of the cooler. A facetious comment, indeed, as they were warmer than room temp. 

Our appetizer, loaded fries, was served cold (yes, colder than those glasses). My first clue should've been the intact shredded cheese on top. The flavor of the pork was actually pretty good, but the whole thing was fridge-cold. When our server finally checked on us & we told her, she apologized profusely & took it away with the promise of a hot order ASAP. And the replacement was fantastic! The BBQ sauce was sweet but not overly so, and nicely accented the sweet potato waffle fries. And the shredded pork was amazing. Interestingly, this second order didn't have any green onions; see my photos. Not an issue at all, but noted. 

We ordered the Swashbuckler Basket to share, and thank goodness we did - it was HUGE! And delicious! Two giant pieces of white fish, a good-size skewer of scallops, and three of the largest shrimp I've ever seen, all fried & served on top of a big basket of fries. So much yummy food for $16.99! This was a steal for the quantity & quality of seafood we enjoyed. 

Our server was ok. She was friendly when she came to our table, but she didn't check on us often. She seemed more interested in a nearby table of 8 that was seated shortly after we were. Once we'd paid, while we were still finishing our pitcher, I saw her cash out & sit with another server across the bar, so we may have been her last table (apparently that table of 8 didn't order food). Her end-of-shift attitude was obvious. I understand, but don't like it. 

The ladies bathroom was terrible. Lots of stalls, but the only empty stall had something disgusting in the bowl that staff hadn't cleaned up. Then the first stall that opened was completely out of toilet paper, so I waited longer. The third stall was the charm. But I noticed their auto-flush toilets don't really work, which may explain the situation in the first stall. Regardless, the bathroom had clearly not been stocked or cleaned in a while. 

After dinner, we walked down to the beach bar. What a disaster going on out there! The bar itself is fairly large, also serving people walking up from the fire pits & tables in the sand, with only 2 bartenders on a Friday night. This is where the action was at Whiskey Joe's, but the wait at the bar was atrocious, both to get our drinks & to cash out. We gave up after the first round. 

The parking situation is ridiculous... Valet parking is nearly mandated, as only half an aisle is self-parking in the restaurant's lot. Paid public parking nearby has signs posted everywhere that the lot is closed & locked at 9pm. But when we left at 10:30, that lot was still accessible. Valet parking was only $5, but being forced to use it left me feeling manipulated - a bad start to the evening. 

The food is the only reason I'm giving Whiskey Joe's a 3rd star. Service was barely 2 stars, and the bathroom situation almost makes me deduct a star. Given the great food & proximity to home, we'll surely return, with lower expectations.

We landed, checked in and headed over. Food was good(shrimp tacos). We sat on the beach side and our server, Grey, was excellent!!! Had a great time. Felt like we were at the ocean even thou it's on the bay!
Morgan was our waitress on a very special Birthday night with a demanding group!! Very impressed with her and we will be back!  Thanks, Morgan you ROCK!

The seafood mac n' cheese was one of the best things I've ever eaten. The chef has a blend of a few different cheeses in there that's absolutely spectacular, and the shrimp complements it really well. I also had the mussels appetizer - the sauce was super tasty. The place itself is pretty nice, they've got a great view with an awesome beach bar and a gift shop. All in all a great experience.

Located conveniently close to Tampa off the causeway and across from Hogan's Beach, Whiskey Joe's offers a more spacious and more relaxed beach than Hogan's to enjoy tropical frozen drinks, live acoustic band, corn hole, a camp fire at night, and some seafood. You can pull up your boat or jetskies on the east side of whiskey Joe's by the barefoot beach area. On the west side of Whiskey Joe's there is an air conditioned indoor bar, outdoor deck, and 1 volleyball court. I prefer this place over Hogan's because it's more relaxed and more spacious. Naturally, this place loses a star because the beach is not as nice as St Pete or Clearwater because it is in the Bay with stagnant water and sludgy ocean floor sand but it is conveniently close to Tampa and a popular boaters hangout if you don't feel like trekking all the way out to another beach. They have a large variety or frozen drinks: traditional mojito, mango mojito, strawberry orange cooler, whiskey Joe's lemonade, true blue, razz lemonade, arctic chill, spiced colada, Bacardi punch, and margaritas. They also have a $3 domestic Brewskies special until 7 most days, otherwise it's $3.50 which is pretty reasonable compared to Hogan's or Bahama Breeze next door. Their margaritas aren't the best but those frozen drinks are pretty good. I had their Mahi Mahi tacos and fire cracker shrimp and they were pretty good. Service at the outside bar can take awhile if it's busy because it's a big bar and they usually only have 2 or 3 server but that's expected. When Hogan's does EDM concerts I usually watch them from here next to the fire.  You can catch a nice sunset from the west side of whiskey Joe's opposite the barefoot beach area. Will be coming back again! Thanks!

Cons: The outside bathrooms are nasty port-o-potties but they got regular bathrooms if you walk inside. Their drink prices are higher than average at $6.50 for well mixed drinks and $9 for frozen tropical drinks.  There is limited valet parking onsite only and a pay lot for Ben T Davis Beach operated by credit card until 6pm, but if you come after 6pm, you can park for free!

If this restaurant had a face, I would punch it. I knew when I walked in, the food would suck. It just had that " hey, we don't give a shit  about the food kinda vibe". Oh well, been to places like that before so..... think.... what can I order they cant screw up AND wont make me sick. Ta Da Tacos, cooked meat, a flour tortilla, hot sauce, yep this might actually work.  OMG and yes I just shouted OMG. First bite I got the distinct taste of mold. Yep, mold like when you eat a piece of bread that is a day too old, and has those little blue/green specs on the crust. I examined the tortilla carefully, It cant be moldy. It actually looked fine so I took a small bite of the steak. YEP, inspector Columbo I am. Found the offender but how? How the hell do you get mold taste onto beef?  The meat was soaked in a marinade, Mojito is what I think the menu said. It had to be in there somewhere, I don't know exactly but I know what it tasted like and that was mold. The good news is the server responded immediately with the offer of a replacement meal. I ordered the wings and they were just like any wings at any crappy restaurant. Which after having my food taste of mold... was a welcome change.

Passed by this restaurant all the time while visiting the Clearwater Beach and decided to finally stop by. Nicer better outside looking than Hogan's, server was very friendly and food outstanding. The only reason I knocked down 1 Star is because they sold me the $20 coconut and refills where $8 dollars and bill doesn't disclose that. They claim they can do whatever drink they don't specify will be well then they charge you the premium liquor separate. It's too confusing, otherwise it was a pleasant experience.

Outside service is terrible. You have to flag a server down and they seem to do their best to avoid new tables. 

Food and drinks are decent for the price and it's a pretty fun atmosphere on the weekends 

Come for the fun, not the service

Are you kidding me ,  on the water awesome view.... But warm beer in old plastic cups.  My boyfriend's cup actually exploded.... No offer of replacing.  No wait staff or food offered that I could see.  Great potential if you can get it together

Unfortunately the anticipation for the sunset was spoiled by horrible parking.  It continued with ridiculous service. If you are sat and greeted late then the water,appetizers should be brought fast. In addition the entrees were cold. Busy restaurant with subpar management equals a subpar experience.  Food wasn't even finished means taste buds were not jumping....stay away from this place if you can. There's no other spots really to watch sunsets so just watch and dip!
Casual Bar, Good Atmosphere and Great for families as well. We sent back the nachos but the Shrimp and Sausage quesadilla were Bomb..

Slow, unorganized( heard that out of the bartenders lips while sitting there) subpar food..bartenders ask you if you need anything, then look puzzled because you ask for a menu. Also and I hate to say this but..very rude and unattractive people that work here with major attitudes. I'm sorry that I don't relate to your backwoods, redneck ass(bud light)..but yeah I would like to see what bottles you have on your drink menu.
I will say it's a damn shame because you have a great location with hell of a view..could be a great vibe but it's not. Invest in your people. I'll be at Aqua across the street.

Went here for lunch and was fortunate to miss any crowds. The parking lot was full so thanks for the complimentary valet. The restaurant looked fairly clean and was pretty spacious. We sat outside and enjoyed the beautiful view. 

Service was quick and friendly. Our waitress knew the menu pretty well and served our drinks pretty quickly. Beer was tasty and the sweet tea was good. The food was good as well (I had blackened grouper sandwich), but definitely not anything to rave about. The fries could have been better and I rarely ever feel that way. 

Overall I had a good time. It definitely was a welcoming place with good food and a great location. I would definitely recommend this place for food and drinks and fun, and definitely plan on returning.

Went here with my family for dinner and drinks, and I was not impressed at all. The best part of this place was seeing the wildlife in the water over the patio, which sits out over the water, and the waitress was good. As soon as we we're seated at 9:30 on a Thursday night, the waitress informed us that we had 2 minutes to order before the kitchen closed. After rushing to order at a place I never been before, I ordered an entree with grilled fish, scallops and shrimp all over cooked and chewy. Ultimately I paid 200 bucks for 4 adults and 2 children and the only thing that tasted worth a Damn was the gator bites. I wouldn't return to this place if they had free drinks and free food......PS I still tipped the waitress 45 bucks even tho she gave me 95 dollars in 5s as my change, cause it ain't her fault the owner shouldn't be allowed to own a cat,let alone a restaurant and bar on the water.

Location is amazing off the beach. Great view from the table looking out to the water. If it wasn't due to the location I don't think this place would still be in business anywhere else. Went with a big crowd of 12 ppl. There was a long wait for the table. I was so disappointed to wait so long for bland food. Had 3 shrimp tacos which tasted like frozen shrimp from the grocery store. I only ate one. Didn't like anything anyone else ordered.  I won't be back.

Great views and drinks but the food is terrible. I had the crab/artichoke dip and it tasted smokey. The chips were sprinkled with something that made them taste like Doritos. The shrimp pasta had 5 shrimp and no flavor.

I visited on Tuesday, March 22, 2016 and was lucky enough to sit outside on their gorgeous deck.  View was fabulous; was there for happy hour so was able to watch the sun hover over the Tampa Bay.  The atmosphere alone could give this restaurant a 5 star rating...if only it were that easy..

I ordered the Jumbo Gulf Shrimp and my fiancé got the Gator Bites.  For $19.99, I felt like the shrimp was underwhelming at best.  The meal came out in a basket, with 6 shrimp sitting on top of a bed of fries, with a side of cocktail sauce.  If they consider the shrimp I received as jumbo, then I would hate to see what they consider small.  Each shrimp was no bigger than my thumb and deep fried.  The fries were tasty, especially with the vinegar they had sitting at the table.  But for the price point, I was overall disappointed with the meal.

The Gator Bites came with fried pickles in the basket for an overall enjoyable appetizer.   My bill for the 2 meals and 4 beers was just over $50 (beer was priced at $3 for happy hour).  

I would definitely come back, but most likely just stick to sitting at the outside bar to enjoy the beach and cocktails.

So we came here hoping to get brunch but it's their regular menu. This is a super  chill place to hang out. The traditional beach bar vibe. Nice big windows that overlook Tampa bay, lots of outdoor seating. They have a nice house made Bloody Mary. Next door is a beach with dj and reggae. 5 buck cover seemed reasonable for the view. It was getting ready to pour so we passed.

Please come in and try this place. So awesome and so welcoming. We had the pleasure of having Maggie which had an awesome personality and was completely on top of everything. Thanks for making her part of the team so my experience could be perfect. We will definitely be back
Very cool place to hang out. Has a great water front bar and seating. The food was ok. Had the steak tacos which were decent. Its a nice place to wind down after the beach.

Whiskey Joe's Tampa has a cute little set up on the causeway.  If you are looking for a quick stop and want t feel as if your are at the each this is your spot.  The food is hit or miss and the drinks can afford a little more alcohol to be put in them.  The fun theme party's are always awesome no matter the type of music.

I would love to give this place 5 stars on the View alone. The food is good plenty of choices especially if you have a group. The night we went it was rainy so we weren't able to be outside for the sunset. That was a bummer but I guess I can't blame the restaurant for the weather. 

Our server was as sweet as she could be and she was trying her best. I will give her high marks for effort. She did however mention it was only her 2ND day so I'd say she was pretty awesome. I am surprised at management for leaving her to fend for herself so quickly.

Island coconut oyster and firecracker shrimp is a must have to order when you come here! This place is very friendly and food and drinks are very good here. Plus its on the water so you have an excellent view while enjoying your experience!

The view is remarkable, the food isn't. Glorified bar food basically. They offer some gator which is cute for the tourists. By boat or foot this place is best for getting shitfaced, then going to a real restaurant for some real gator..like Charley's. I'm sure to get dragged back here at some point. It's unavoidable.

Going straight to the point - eat at the outside bar. Food ordered is cooked at the food truck! The best! 
My favorite is the Chicken Wings and also the FRIES! (Yep capitalized for a reason, they are that good).
Get the wings without any sauce.
The cocktails are not that great but good enough.
Bring some friends; great atmosphere.

One of my favorite places at Tampa, close to the beach,
Have fun at the beach sand bar, the menu is really good include different king of food, burguers, tacos,
Salads, choices for appetizers... for couple, family and friends..

I wouldn't say this place is bad.... Just nothing special. My fiancé got a burger which was good, and I got the coconut shrimp which were boring. We both got frozen drinks which tasted like a mix without any alcohol ( for which we paid almost ten dollars each). 
The service was good and sitting outside on the deck was very nice. Overall the place seemed like a tourist trap and the limited (and boring) menu made it obvious that management was not interested in having people return.

Came here on a Saturday to enjoy a meal on the sand with out of town friends. When approaching the  beach area at 6:50pm was told that we needed to pay a cover of $10 each because a band was going to play. when I asked what time do they start was told 9pm. Drove all this way to eat at a table on the sand, parking was a joke as the send you to drive to a public lot where it took 15 min to find a spot open. Then forced to pay an entry fee to eat.  Food was ok, drinks expensive and after the hefty entry fee decided to at least see the band start. They were a Katy Perry/No Doubt cover band that was pretty much a karaoke band. They lost the power to their recorded music portion for a bit and had to stop. Comical to watch a guy fake play the keyboards as his fingers didnt even touch the keys.... and you charged us for this?  Ridicules ..at least the wait staff was nice.

If you opt to sit inside get a table by the window and enjoy beautiful, relaxing ocean views! We were a party of four. One had a hamburger with fries. It was a huge burger patty and he enjoyed it. My husband and I had a shrimp and crab Louie salad which was plentiful and tasty as well. The only off thing is that I felt they could have been a bit more generous with the crab. Not enough there. Otherwise, a very good and size-able salad with just enough large, tasty shrimp to satisfy. Another had the grilled fish special which I tasted. It was a moist, large piece of fish (my friend couldn't eat it all), and flavored to near perfection.

In many restaurants you can find souvenir T-shirts. Usually you will find loud, crazy, colorful ones with the logo or name of the restaurant in addition to more reserved, tasteful, less tacky ones. I prefer the latter, but when I looked for one of those to purchase, I found none. So, not wanting a loud, cartoon'ish, in your face, type of souvenir to wear I didn't get one there. Hopefully, they will have a better selection when I return. And, I will return for their food and beautiful location!

Location A+ you can see amazing sunsets from this place and if you are lucky enough also dolphins playing around the bay. We got the shrimp appetizer and two burgers. Shrimp were really tasty :) burgers were okay. Cocktails are way too sweet tho.
Do yourself a favor and stick with week days.
Weekends are a nightmare! Drunk people screaming and throwing up all over the place/parking lot.
Great service our waitress Aleah was awesome! Very attentive nice view and food was good shrimp tacos

A few days ago, I took my fiance to Whiskey Joe's.  The food was better than I expected.  But, truly this is a review of our server, Miss Jenny Cobin.  I have been in the restaurant business all my adult life...over 30 years.  Miss Cobin was one server to remember.  She never approached the table without a smile.  She was at the table within a few minutes of our sitting down.  She brought our drink order within two minutes.  She knew her menu and was able to answer all of our questions.  

I am a smoker, so we started outside.  I asked for an ashtray and she immediately began scouring the landscape for one.  There weren't any outside, none in the server station, so she went all the back to the dishwasher to find the elusive thing.  It seemed a storm was coming across the bay, and Jenny said, "Don't worry, if the storm comes here, I'll have a table ready for you inside."  

Again, the food was good.  We love the calamari at Whiskey Joe's.  The mussels were great.  The Mahi Tacos could probably use a little more sauce; but, they were also very good.

The hardest thing for most servers to understand is the time it takes to get a check and get change.  Most servers blow it at this point.  Not Miss Cobin.  We asked for the check, got it moments later, and a minute or two later, she picked it up...perfect.  She parted with an invitation to return.  When I asked for a comment card, it seems Whiskey Joe's does not use them.  However, she said they read Yelp religiously.  So, I am here to give management my feedback, as well as the world.  

Thanks Miss Cobin for a great evening!
Sincerely,
John

Very touristy and chain-like... although i don't know if its a chain... but the food isn't bad.

The food is decent but easily forgettable. It's island sounding burgers, seafood bar appetizers, and other seafood. Red Lobster married Applebees. Nothing very WOW. Good place to grab drinks and bring some friends. My burger was cooked well, good size, nothing overpowering. Same with the fries.

The servers are very helpful and the decorations try to keep an island getaway vibe. It threw me off that there's a gift shop up front but the view of the bay outside the windows are amazing. A part of the restaurant actually sits on stilts above the water. Other than that, the place is forgettable... so i'd rather just park my car along the causeway and watch the bay.

I've been to this restaurant a number of times and each and every time I've been there, the service has been TERRIBLE. Takes forever for the wait staff to come by the table, takes forever for them to take your order, takes forever for your drinks to come, takes forever for them to clear away dirty dishes, takes forever to get your check, and takes forever to receive your change. And I'm pretty sure I've had a different server each time There are, however, two pluses to this restaurant... Food is well prepared and somewhat more creative than you find at the typical seafood chains; and the view is absolutely amazing. Now if only they'd do something about their wait staff.
Meh. Overpriced decent food. The only thing I will eat here are the nachos (woof). Avoid Sunday's at all cost.

The food was very good. We cone here fairly often. We sat outside beach side and they had a band playing. The only complaint I have is, I would like them to tend to their outside bathrooms more to keep them cleaner and have the hand sanitizer filled for their customers. This is important considering they are eating food. The servers could also be more attentive, especially when it is not very busy.

We had a great time last night at Whiskey Joe's. We were seated right away, and we loved the beach themed decor. The views this place has are gorgeous, not a bad seat in the house. Our drink orders were fun, as my wife ordered a virgin piña colada (6 months pregnant) and I ordered the ultimate coronarita. The food was great on my end as I ordered the black and blue cheeseburger! Cajon seasoned beef with creamy blue cheese, so good! My wife had a bowl of clam chowder, which was pretty good, but was missing something. All in all we had great time, and the music/culture of the restaurant is relaxing... Which of course is what vacationing is all about. Way to go Whiskey Joe!

I have been here numerous times now and have debated on how to write this review. It seems that if you eat inside or sit at the beach bar service is average and the same can be said about the food. If you are sitting at a table at the beach service will be slow sometimes very slow. With that being said if you are on vacation it can still be a cool place to go if it is your last day in town as it is close to the airport.

Maggie and Nicole were very nice and made the night better with their out going personality!!!!!
Great food!! Atmosphere was perfect. We sat on the deck and our table was right on the edge so we overlooked the water. We watched some fish swim while we drank and waited for our food. I accidentally knocked over my drink from the bar and they quickly cleaned it up and brought me another one. Will definitely go back. Loved it!!!!

Great spot! I took a client there for dinner and drinks on wednesday night. It was a lot of fun. Cool beach area where you can chill with a large, covered outdoor island bar with tvs on the beach of the bay.  Sat inside for dinner then moved outside, Ash behind the tiki bar was very friendly and entertaining. She was even a big help when there may have been some obvious "lulls in conversation"...made an otherwise dull business meeting a little more bearable.  I had the huge grilled fish tacos. Plenty of food and good flavor. Check it out.
Ashley is exquisite in her ability to provide the finest service. Always courteous, friendly, smiling, prompt and intuitive. You will enjoy the finest time.

OVER PRICED HORRIBLE FOOD! 

I went here because I always drove by and saw it packed. It's got a great view of the bay and the menu looked good. Man was I fooled! It took like 10 minutes after I was sat for someone to realize I was there. I ordered Mac and cheese & a jerk chicken sandwich with fries. Everything had no taste. The fries had the most flavor of everything. The mac and cheese would of been $12 and the chicken sandwich and fries would of been $12. The only good thing was I told the manager and they took the food and took it off the bill so I can say the service was good once they actually came to the table but the food wasn't worth the money. I got a look at the drink menu and the prices are double what I would pay at like applebees.

The food and drinks were so good! Nachos for an appetizer were huge and the gator bites were yummy!!  thats all we needed to order to eat. Margarita's were on point!  Sadly had it spilt down my leg by the waiter and then when he went to pick up the plates he knocked me straight in the face. Let's just say the food and drinks were great but my waiter was so clumsy. All in all I would still come back

If you're looking for dangerous fun on the water with a bunch of irresponsible jet-ski owners, then this is the spot for you. Apparently some lady was hit by a jet ski just the day before, knocking her baby from her arms. While I understand this place is probably not a great family atmosphere, I also know that there is a certain population of people, *ahem* Hispanics that bring their skis up there just to show how awesomely cool they are, 20 feet from shore going 40+. If you think I'm being overly critical of one race then go find out for yourself. My girlfriend and I have waverunners ourselves but it makes us look bad with all of these people out there acting like morons. Probably a great place to come wait for a devastating watercraft accident to happen. Sad to say but this is the truth of Whiskey Joes on the weekend.

I have only been here once despite living close by and visiting Clearwater beach often. This place is right off the highway to Clearwater and has the most amazing views!! We sat at the bar as the whole place was very busy , including the patio. The beach area has a fee to enter and is a great place to hang out with friends. Would definitely visit again.
Nice place. Standard bar with all the normal booze and beer. The kicker here was location. Right on the bay, it was gorgeous. They also have a beach bar, pretty awesome.

The food and service was excellent last night. We had nachos, garlic bread and pizza. The drinks were really good as well. We sat outside and the view was amazing. We got there just in time for the sunset. We will be back for sure.

This review is solely about the Barefoot Bar. 

We were there on a Monday afternoon, and had the perfect seats at the bar. The girls were great, ESPECIALLY Brooke! She is one heck of a bartender. Being one myself, that is a pretty bold statement.

The Caesar salad was yummy! The seasoning was really good, and unusual for a salad. We were both thoroughly impressed. The sand was pristine, and you can even pull your boat up to the sand and just relax. 

Hopefully, we can come out on a night where it's really hopping.

Overall an incredibly relaxing place. 

Ps- ask Brooke to make you a Barrel Roll. :)
So and so place. Peanuts are always stale, fish tacos are mediocre. On the other hand staff is always nice and friendly

Sunday Funday done right. Right off the causeway awaits an oasis party zone. Great spot to grab a drink and mingle with others as you watch jet skies zip around the bay.  Tiki bar has a wide selection of beer and the standard beach concoctions.  We didn't eat in the restaurant but seemed like a nice set up with a great view of the bay.

I love Whiskey Joe's! Any seat in the house has a great view of the sunset over the bay.If you prefer the fresh air, you can get food and drinks outside on the deck or go downstairs on the beach! I also love to come in the summer to watch the rain roll in over the water. This is one of the only places to go to escape the storm and still feel like you are on the beach. 
They have a great drink menu. For a few bucks more, you can get any drink in one of a few different really neat souvenir cups. 
The menu isn't huge but they hit a few be-achy favorites like fish tacos or chicken wings. I usually look at the menu for a few minutes but always go back to my favorite, the nachos!
The only draw back is there is not enough parking at all, but they do have valet.
We have been here a few times now and now if we are near Tampa we eat here.   Thanx to Jake for making momma smile before she left back to Michigan.

The location is awesome and magical, waitresses are nice and sweet, the food was OK but their drinks suck! I ordered a tropical Hama mama or something like that..its awful and had a fly in it.

I would come back for the location and the food but not drinks.
Whiskey joes is right on the water and most the hotels shuttle to here as well. They have live music!!!!!

View: breathtaking (on the water outside seating, on the man made beach, inside all glass enclosure to ensure you have the view, you win in any spot you prefer to sit)
Service: very good
Food: had mojito tacos. Amazing!
Price: reasonable ($11 for the tacos)

Really liked it

To be honest I just really like the location and views.  The veggie garden pizza and the shrimp tacos are my go to every time I visit.  I also like their calamari it's always soft. The creamy Alfredo pasta is kinda bland and the chicken on top was super dry (but my mom thought it was good (so to each his own).Food is good not great but I always end up coming back because of their location.

Five Star View. 

You would think Tampa has an abundance of places to eat and stare at water...you would think.   

It isn't easy, and that is why Whiskey Joe's is on my list of best sunset spots in Tampa. If you can't make it over to the beach, then WJ's back deck will do the trick.  

You can't see the sunset from Bahama Breeze or Landry's, and in fact it is limited from Crabby Bill's.  But at Whiskey Joe's it is unlimited. 

I particularly liked the lost and found sunglasses available for those dining outside, but as far as food, I wouldn't stray too far from the fish tacos (decent) and gator bites (good).

Food was disgusting. Service was super slow. bartenders outside are incompetent, rude, and be prepared to wait 30 mins for a can of beer. Too bad cause the scenery was nice, but I am NOT referring to the bar staff!
Food was good. Exactly the quality you'd expect from a waterside tourist type place. Prices were higher than comparable restaurants.

Dirty beach bar, while the live music ever wasn't bad, the bar manager has little care about the customers he offends and the prices are above where they should be. The only great thing about this place was the view and you can get that from any of the other places close by like Bahama Breeze for example!

I experienced a very upsetting situation. My family and I arrived at Whiskey Joe's and placed our name on the list to sit outside. We were told we would have no wait as there was no one on the list to sit outside. My family and I waited 30 minutes patiently while a few tables remained empty and uncleaned. After witnessing 3 other families seated outside before us, even after we were told that there was no wait and that we were the only ones waiting, we decided to leave. Though the servers and hostess were aware that we were waiting and that I had checked in to confirm we were still waiting for a table outside, they still sat people outside who had just arrived, before us. As we were walking out the hostess said she was just going to seat us and rather than apologize for our long wait we received a sarcastic bye. 

I had previously rated Whiskey Joe's a 3, because it is a neat place to see the sunset while sipping on a drink. My new review is based on the poor level of service I and my family received. My family was visiting from out of state and I wanted to share a gorgeous Florida sunset with them and rather was seriously embarrassed by the service received.

Whiskey Joe's was okay. The view was very nice. The food was not so great. I got the cheeseburger sliders. They were okay, but overpriced. The cornbread was burnt at the bottom. The service was slow. Granted they were busy, but it could have been quicker. If you're just going for drinks and a nice view, this place would be great. However, if you want great food, then this is not the place to go.
Gator bites good. Had recommended scallops, rice, and shrimp. Food good but missing some spices. Service friendly and pleadant.

Our initial impression wasn't very good at the barefoot bar but as soon as we went to the restaurant and were helped by Brittany, our entire experience changed. She is an awesome waitress and was super nice and helpful to us. Will go back just because of her service

Bar smells like mildew. We walked in bartender said hi and walked off, never asked if she could help us, seemed annoyed that we were there. This place is gross for real, bar counters are sticky.  Alright great talk.
So disappointed .   Jumbo shrimp was so small; not as described on menu.  Parking was valet only $5 when we arrived
You get what you see. No surprises there. Standard beach bar and sub standard bar food. Good for a beer @

Service slow, food blah, restaurant in need of refresh.  Great view of bay, but that is about it.  

Better choices all around.  Pass on this place.
This was the worst place I went to they have also no food you have a limit on the table! Valet was horrible they scratch up my 10,000 dollar rim! I would NEVER EVER COME BACK!!!!

Okay as we walk in, I asked if the food was fresh "like no frozen shit, box - bag clam chowder  " she said all was fresh... mmmm NO. THE DRINKS WOW the bartender needs to get back into cocktail school. This person couldn't mix a freaking rum and coke. The waiter forgot our starter appetizers witch is good,  because the FOOD WAS ALL FUCKED UP. WE had the grouper sandwich, and me and my wife are people who know what fresh grouper taste and looks like. BUT WHAT pissed me off the most wast the freaking drinks 40$ in 4 cocktails. . NEVER AGAIN. .

I wanted to like this restaurant. Cool location. I disagree with reviewers about the weak drinks. I had two very berry mojitos today and they were quite strong. Very yummy. I had the slow roasted pork tacos. They were just ok. My friend got the shrimp salad with key lime dressing. She thought the crab meat was imitation crabmeat and it was loaded with mayo. She barely touched it. Just picked out the shrimp and she's not picky at all.  Stick to the basics here and you'll be happy.

Fish and Chips were good.  
Atmosphere was lacking.  Hostesses were really nice, server no so much!

The fancy fruity drinks we had were made with fresh mango and they were delicious, but it was hard to taste any alcohol in them.  We had peel 'n eat shrimp which were great.  I had a salad which was good and my friend had scallops on a skewer which she said were very good.

The view is the thing about this place.  Right on the water with amazing access to the sunset!  The atmosphere is great too.  The service is friendly and laid back.  The music's not too loud and people of all ages are in attendance.  Loved spending a few hours there.
Average at best. Service outside was slow and I don't think our server was into working that day. Food was only so-so and I wouldn't necessarily come back for that.

I'm going 4-1/2 here ! Was really good atmosphere outside and food was great. The pork tacos were amazing. The burgers are great, rice and beans were legit and the wings were good. Beer selection could be a little better but the Cadillac (Jacks) Margarita is on point ! I reserve my 5 ratings for the elite but this place was close. First vacation in Florida and this was our first stop for lunch after getting off the plane .

Good spot and location for a dinner for local and tourists.  Stopped by for dinner after work and it was a good spot.  Unfortunately it was raining so you really couldn't get a good view of the bay but you can tell it's a nice spot when the weather is nice.

I had gator nuggets as my appetizer and they're great.  Jambalaya was my entree and it was not too spicy and just right.  The wings my coworkers had was on steroids and their desserts were huge.  The server was good and very attentive.  Good music played in the background which made it that much more fun.

If I'm back this way I'd hit it again.

Not too shabby of a place. Went out with a group of friends here last night and food was good. Restaurant has a great view and is right on the water. I ordered the Gator Bites (yum!) and the Seafood Mac 'n Cheese. Tasted okay, nothing to write home about. I'd deffo bring out of town visitors here for a unique place for dinner.

Had lunch at the bar on a Thur around 3:00pm.  The staff was very friendly and courteous but the bar area was filthy.  There were fruit flies everywhere which I can get around but then I noticed the crud on the side of beer taps and on front of drawer.  Won't visit here again.  Food was only OK.

I was in town for work and wanted to eat somewhere with a water view. I was pleasantly surprised by the view, even though we missed sunset. The staff was friendly and the food was great! I had the firecracker shrimp tacos and they were the perfect portion. They could have been a little spicier, but I ate them all, so they couldn't have been bad! 

Lilly was our waitress and she was excellent! Very friendly and took great care of us! 

Great place to see the water and beach!

Driving by the place, I was looking for a nice meal with terrific view and atmosphere. Parking lot crowded, restaurant and bar empty. WTH??... Anyway...The sticky table and dirty silverware suggested that we should try and order something simple. We ordered nachos and shrimp. First bite on the nachos made me want to try the shrimps. Tried one... well.. I will try the nachos again.
Both simply uneatable. The tortilla tasted kind of bitter, burned, fired in an old oil... I gave up.
My wife ate some shrimps, I don't know how. We comlpained about the nachos, which we barely touched, the waitress said."Im sorry"..and that's is. No discount, nothing. Left the place hungry. $40 down the drain. It was a LONG time since I had such a BAD meal. Amazing. I should not have paid.

Only three stars but food was delicious...the reason for the three stars is because we called ahead to ask if they had any steak available on the menu we were told yes, if the answer would have no we would have ate elsewhere...so forward to the restuarant we arrive to an empty lobby area no one at the desk, several staff members walk by without acknowledging were there finally we do get seated and order appettizers and when we attempt to order steak we are told there is no steak...okay wierd guess we'll do burgers...the appettizers arrive and actual appettizer gator bites are far overwhelmed with basketfilling lettuce, but however small the portion it was well prepared the burgers though were pretty fantastic, but they weren't steak...

Love the location, definitely a beach bar atmosphere.  Service was great.  The seating inside at the large bar area and seating outside in the deck is nice.  There's a separate restaurant area for more of a dining atmosphere.  It would definitely be a frequent stop if it wasn't quite so far away for us.

But what really inspired this review is that they have the best con queso I've ever had.  It's definitely not just cheese and salsa.  We ordered it with taco meat which comes on the side.  The portion was very large.  It's definitely something you should try.

Loved this place!! Just didn't like that I couldn't change my sides. I ordered salmon and wanted broccoli instead of fries but that wasn't an option. However, the view was awesome and the bar on the beach with fire pits was super fun! :)

The walk in experience was not good.  We sat at the bar waiting for our table.  It took 15 mins for someone to acknowledge us, no one was smiling behind the bar it was horrible.  They ran out of bar glasses and were serving beers in water glasses, the cocktail glasses were very dirty.  The only experience that made the night was our awesome waitress Natasha she took great care of us and worked with the backed up bar and kitchen!  The food was good and came out in a timely manner.  Being locals we may not frequent here as much after this experience.

Let me start the review by saying I've never eaten here. But it's a good place to come and hang out by the water and have drinks with friends. Lots of room and it's almost always hop'n. Live music most weekends.

I would love to tell you how the food was but sat at a table outside on the beach for an hour...no exaggeration, and was never approached. Beer was cold. Bartenders were quick to serve. Only reason I gave them 2 stars. Great atmosphere. Good music. I'll be back but definately sitting at the bar not on a beach table.

Hers:
Food was average at best, view was nice. Nothing that special, although the drunk people around us seemed to be having a blast. Difficult parking because it was packed on a weekend afternoon in March.

His:
I've been here multiple times during different times of the year and the view is always the same. Location is nice, food is average at best. The best thing this place has going for it is location and closeness to the water. If you're looking for a casual waterfront drink for a decent price this is it. If you're looking for a place to eat with above average standards, look elsewhere.

Went for dinner Saturday pm- valet said lot was full either and to  park in beach lot or drive down to "event parking" and take shuttle back.  We found a spot at beach- parked, paid and went into restaurant. Checked with hostesses  at front-  they could not tell us whether we'd get locked in lot at 9 pm or not as (signage stated at beach)-- so ended up moving our car and taking shuttle after all.  Confusing and annoying.  Food was ok-  waitress was great.  I gave it 2 stars because we enjoyed our friends company and sitting on the outside patio.

Worst service ever! Cool idea, done badly. Skip the insanity of parking, the over-marketing and find another place. Unless, that is, you want to wait for over an hour to get a burger. Not worth your time.

Except the view of the TAMPA Bay and the fast service, this place is horrible. With jet ski rides right there and the unbelievable amount of noise they generate, you can even hear yourself. You feel like you want to just finish up and leave just so the noise stops!! Worst than this was the extremely greasy fried food.
