They were drenched in extremely unhealthy looking frying oil that kids couldn't even finish them. This place is only good for having drinks on deck after sunset (jet skis go away!) and nothing else. No food! Two stars is for the view, not for the restaurant!
Great location , good food , great presentation , good crowd & overall good place to hangout specially around sunset !!

Got some major beef with this popsicle stand. DO NOT GO AT LOW TIDE (unless ur in to that). When my homies walked into the tiki bar area, they got hosed by some dude pretending to be a bouncer who charged them each a bogus $5 cover. Food is overpriced and there was some trash Kennedy Chesney cover band playing the same three songs all night. I kindly asked the dude to play some 80's Joel and he flipped me off. WTF?!? Other that that, beach volleyball was great! Except for these two kids kept starting beef with my team. They were only like 6yo but they were talkin some of the heaviest heat I've felt in years. 
Tampa is weird place and this place surely screams Tampa. 
GO BUCKS!!!

Looks like a fun place, but is definitely a tourist trap with all the products for sale as soon as you walk into the restaurant. We found the wings to be pretty awesome but nothing else that we ordered. Overall the food is less than mediocre and over-priced. We went on a Sunday evening for a simple dinner on the water.  We ordered the spicy Thai chicken wings for our appetizer along with a draft beer and a frozen strawberry margarita (which came in a daiquiri glass, huh?) The wings were really good and cooked right. We were happy. I ordered the fish tacos and my husband ordered a cheeseburger. The fish tacos were pretty much tasteless, the "sauce" added nothing to the tacos. The cheeseburger which my husband ordered medium, came RAW in the middle. We politely sent it back, but no apologies from the waitress. Needless to say, I was finished with all I was going to eat of the tacos before the cheeseburger came back, this time cooked correctly. We had a food bill of about $65 for about $12 of good food. BTW they charge $12 for the margarita. I don't get why places like this, that have the potential to be great, just don't care about quality, therefore, lose out on return business and recommendations.

Music overhaul of the worst kind.     They changed their music to only 80's rock - soooooo dated!!!!!     They went from having a tropical, caribbean vibe to making me feel like I should be wearing acid jeans with the holes up the sides.     SUCH A DISAPPOINTMENT!!!!

We were in Tampa for a few days, and thought this place looked like fun. When we arrived we were put off by the fact that there was ONLY valet parking. The valet was rude and condescending. We decided to stay anyway and put our name in for a table. We went to the bar while we were waiting for our table, and it took 10 to 15 minutes for anyone to acknowledge our presence. I felt sorry for the staff, because the place was unorganized and tables outside were too close together. Not a fun place in my opinion.

We had fabulous service from Lindsey! My mother came into town to visit from Wisconsin and spread my grandpas ashes in the ocean for Father's Day. Lindsey brightened our day during a very hard time! She provided excellent service. Lindsey went way above and beyond the call of duty. On top of her amazing table side manor the long islands were great and the garlic mussels were so tasty! Thank you so much Lindsey for helping us celebrate my papas life instead of mourning. We will be back for the great service, drinks and awesome food!

Whole experience was great!

Started with the valet which is only $5 and very friendly and professional, totally worth it.

Service inside was quick and friendly.  Food came out quickly and was delicious.

For the cost you can't beat the view!

We had such a great waiter! He was so attentive and personable. The food was pretty good as well and they had a nice beer selection. We enjoyed sitting on the deck on the water on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. I really appreciate that dogs are allowed. My dog loved it as well!

I was on the wait list when I asked to use bathroom, I was directed to tiki bar outdoor bars bathroom( one in restaurant was being repaired), tiki bathroom was a sani can with no service or lights, used my cell phone flashlight and uninal was clogged and toilet was overfilled, there were no sinks or sanitizer, I alerted my party to conditions and everybody wanted to leave, where does male staff clean up and use bathroom, it was upsetting to think they would try to operate without facilities, I heard others complain also.

We lived here for two years and did not go because of some of the reviews.  Finally went because we had our college age daughter and her friend and I though the location would be fun regardless of the food.  Well the food was GREAT.  We got four different types of tacos, all fresh, great tasting.  We got the calamari which was excellent.  We will go back.  My assumption was that it was a college, sand, beer, type place.  No, it was nice, clean (sorry other reviewer the bathrooms were super clean when I was there) and all ages of people there.  Great for the whole family.

This place blew my mind!!! The outside of the restaurant is beautiful and there are families and people enjoying the sun and beautiful water right on the side of the building. We sat right outside it was a beautiful day and our waiter was pretty busy but awesome he handled everything with speed and grace. His name escapes me at the moment which I am sorry for because he definitely deserves some type of recognition. Everything we ordered was delicious and came out piping hot!!! Every time I'm in the area I will be stopping by!!

Low quality people work here 
Sleezy rules: bilk for valet where u wait in a long long line of cars because you have more seats than you should for the state of your parking lot and cover then have too many people so have smelly ports potties. All the tables taken. Any way general boo and hiss. 

Consequently low quality clientele on the noisy beach.

Recommend finding another location if you are looking to eat food.  If drinking only, it might be okay.  Service was non-existent.  Had to walk up to the bar 3 separate times for a server to come take our order even though tables around us were being waited on.  No apologies or explanation.  Hostess gave us Full menus.  Only found out at time of order that our menus don't apply to our area.
Love this place, always an easy and relaxing time. Food is always good. I've never sat inside but honestly who wants to do that!! I had the Cobb salad minus the blue cheese dressing. Amazing.

1st stop on a recent visit to Tampa - lunch at Whiskey Joe's.  It was a weekday, so we had our pick of tables.  The weather was cool for Feb, but the sun was shining so we took a table on the deck over the water.  Dining on the water is one of life's little pleasures, but when seagulls are dive-bombing your table every 8 minutes or so, the experience leaves something to be desired.  Work on one of those fishing-wire-canopies, Whiskey Joe's!

The food was good.  My chopped salad was light and tasty.  The po' boys were huge.  And the fries had great seasoning (at least what we could eat before the birds got to them).  If you're ordering beers with your meal, the pitchers are a good deal.  They're actually mini-pitchers, but they fill up three pint glasses and cost less than three drafts, so you come out ahead.

The bar area was pretty big and they had lots of games on the TVs.  Couple that with the free peanuts they offer, and I'll bet this is a good place to kick back when a game is on.

Great view, mediocre food, and probably the worst service I've ever experienced. And I don't say that lightly. We finally came to the conclusion that our waitress was high, or at least drunk, because she was completely incompetent. We had to ask for everything- drinks, forks, refills- at least twice, and we were already laughing about how terrible the service was when she finally brought the food- or at least most of it. I sat there for a few minutes at least before she had to be reminded of a) what I ordered and b) that she'd forgotten to put in the order. My very mediocre burger finally arrived as all my companions were finishing. She  did not even offer to comp any part of the meal, and we sat there quite a while longer while she struggled to figure out how to split a bill evenly. Very disappointing, and despite the incredible location, I will not be back.

Oh Whiskey Joes, you could have it all, but you need to expand your kitchen or staff. The view is amazing, the drinks are great, the food is good, the service, I'm sorry, is below average. 

If you're hungry, you're better off sitting outside where you'll get slightly faster service. If you're sitting inside, expect an hour wait for even an appetizer, 30 minutes for a bar drink. 

The view is great - you're right on the water with a man made beach overlooking Tampa bay. I've seen birds diving for fish, dolphins swimming in the bay, and a beautiful sunset or two. The beach bar is big, with a stage featuring live music later in the week. 

Most of my friends rave about the "beer cheese soup." My favorite entree is the fish tacos. My father likes to consider himself a "keylime pie" connoisseur, and he's given them a 5 star review on key lime pie. 

If you want half of the experience they could offer, I would eat outside.

Great location with awesome views and friendly staff! We had a signature special whitefish that was delicious with good happy hour specials at the bar. I would definitely stop again on my way to/from the airport.
Perfect sunset spot great! Great food and service. Best wings we ever had! Will definitely come back and highly recommend. Parking is a bit of a pain the place was packed but we got lucky.

This place is very cool because it is on a decent beach, although not huge, and you can pull your boat up and onto the sand and drop anchor. Jump out of the boat, grab some lawn chairs and sit in the water or on the beach and take in the warm sun rays. 

The drinks were okay and priced about as expected. Live bands on certain nights and lots of nice scenery while having a cold drink make this a neat place to visit. 

The deep water area was not very clearly marked during our boat trip, so we had to rely on technology to make sure we didn't run aground while pulling up to the beach. 

there were jet ski rentals across the way and lots of people out relaxing and having a good time here and in the area.
Stayed at hotel near airport looking for a place on the water with outside bar and great food. The wings are huge and the gator bites are a must try.Friendly staff and great beer specials.

For my friend's birthday, he wanted to find a good place for raw oysters. We were recommended different places from people in the Lion's Den, a cigar bar in Ybor City. After many fails, too crowded, no parking, etc, we found Whiskey Joe! Parking was difficult but we found one. Whiskey Joe is located on a beautiful beachfront area. The views from the restaurant were spectacular. We sat at the bar and ordered shrimp and raw oysters. We were beyond satisfied. The raw oysters were succulent. My friend loved the shrimp so much that he ordered a second plate. Our waitress was good but she was not able to keep up with all the demands she got when it got busy. Everything was so tasty and beautiful that it didn't matter. We ended the day walking on the beach and seeing the sunset.

It's a shame that a restaurant so beautifully located and perfectly set up could be ran so poorly. The service is absolutely horrible!!!! The bartenders at the tiki bar have no customer service skills what so ever. They are rude and lazy. We waited for 20 minutes to get drinks while the 4 bartenders that were behind the bar stood and chatted with each other ignoring customers. One bartender walked past and I said excuse me me and she said "what's up" and kept walking. Than we went upstairs to have dinner in the restaurant and the service was just as bad if not worse. The waitress didn't greet the table for at least 10 minutes. Than she never came back to check on us once our food was delivered. We had no condiments for our burgers. Our orders were not correct but we ate anyways because we were so hungry. Management was no where to be seen. I'm not even sure if there was a manager on duty. Needless to say this place needs a lot of changes.

Great view. Great food. 
Fun place to eat. 
Good local Grouper.
I really like this place. 
When I get back into town I will be back.

I wish I could give this place negative stars. The set up of the establishment is OK, outdated and TOO laid back. I know they are trying to go for the laid back look, but it almost looks DIRTY. My friend and I sat at the bar and the bar was disgusting. From the looks of it, it looked like they hadn't bothered to even wipe down the bar in two days. The cups in which our drinks were poured in also, looked cheap. Another observation I made is that there aren't enough chairs for the bar, but there's a lot of space for more additional chairs=more customers. 

**SERVICE**

I really NEVER complain about service anywhere I go. It doesn't take much to please me,-- sometimes there are legitimate reasons behind the slow service etc. But this time... no excuse. The absolute worst I've ever experienced. There were two female bartenders behind the bar. A blonde and a brunette. The blonde was friendly. The brunette(who might have been pregnant... no just fat) with the tattoo on her lower back was beyond rude. For starters, she was disrespectful and told my friend that the dog wasn't allowed at their establishment, until she figured out the dog was a service dog.She could have approached the situation in a friendlier way.  As if that wasn't bad enough, she took a look at my ID and asked me if I had another form of ID with my name on it because the ID "didn't look like me". This was the FIRST time I've ever been told this and I have been to enough restaurants/bars. What a complete and utter moron.  In addition to questioning my legitimate ID she was very impolite towards us.I don't live in Tampa, but I really urge everyone to STAY AWAY from this place.  Maybe get rid some of your incompetent employees who walk around doing nothing, chatting with each other and hire some new ones who actually want to deliver A+ service!

Terrible service at 2:00pm on a Wed. 
Took forever to get our drinks...
Ordered crabcakes as an appetizer, server never put in the order...
Brought one entree, because the others weren't ready????
Never checked back to see how the food was probably because she was embarrassed.
I don't know if I'll return, which is sad because it's such a great location...

We had a nice time here.  It was a beautiful day & the deck area is a great place for the view of the bay.  The grouper sandwich is delish and my salmon was tasty.  The service is good, just sit under the awning.  Beware of birds.  Definitely a place to go back to for a relaxed, chill day.

We had dinner outside on the deck- awesome view! The waitress was really attentive and our drinks and food were delivered pretty quickly. The drink selection was awesome- they had a pretty good tequila menu.

If you're looking for a place to have a beachside cocktail and grub then this is it. Their burgers, chips, and queso will not disappoint. Pair that with a cold corona dressed and your good to go. Im giving them 4 stars because the food isn't as stellar as the beach view and drink selection. Also, our food took a while to come out during a non-peak hour of the day.

Pretty awful experience.
The only good thing was the location and as far as the food we had the Salad was good.
Things went wrong from the beginning.
We had a reservation for lunch. When we tried to check in, they told us there are no tables available outside,  but if we want we could eat at the beach bar that's part of the place.   We go down the beach and they literally insist on searching our bags.  They refuse entry to the beach because I had a can of water in my bag which you can't leave in your car in the tampa heat.  So we go back to the desk where there are 4, yes 4 people standing at the desk and 1 person checking in.   We had to wait 5 minutes  to be helped... I guess 3 of the people including the manager are just for decoration.   Then they couldn't find the reservation anymore.. other things went wrong...  too bad, we had really wanted to like the place.
Nice place. Great atmosphere and nice staff. I had the shrimp and sausage quesadilla and tried the alligator bites. Both were amazing!

Went to the beach part of the restaurant and our server took 30 minutes to approach us. After dropping of menus, she never came back. We went to the bar to order food and the bartender seemed upset that we only ordered food and no drinks. Food was quick to arrive, but was not very good (my fish tacos were very dry as well as my friend's burger). It was a fun atmosphere due to the beach and DJ, but the service left much to be desired. Will most likely not be returning.

This was my first time at Whiskey Joes. I was initially impressed with the interior and our waitress was friendly so we started off on a good note. Shortly after sitting down I noticed that a different server's butt cheeks were literally hanging out of her shorts. At this point our appetites were quickly fading. Then comes the food. A coworker and I both got the tacos. Midway through the first taco, my coworker found a curly short black hair sticking out. I then checked my tacos and there it was, a short black hair hanging out in my tortilla. The manager came over to ask what happened and then proceeded to ask my coworker where the hair was as if she didn't believe her. I then said that I had a picture and she asked why I would take a picture lol. Good thing I did. They did take the tacos off of the bill and offered a different meal at no cost. However, I still would suggest that you do not go to Whiskey Joe's.

I had such a horrible experience. I was so excited to check this place out since they have one down here in Miami as well. I was with a group of 5 people and we were very hungry and expecting to sit outside with a nice view. We arrived at the front and they told us they weren't sitting outside anymore (even though it wasn't raining and they weren't closing anytime soon) and when we asked the host if we can go down to the section by the sand she said "whatever". We decided to sit by the sand because there was no wait time, but the service was horrible. There was a gentleman with a bandana and a white tank top kinda shirt, and he advised our party that if we wanted to eat we had to order from the bar because they were cutting servers. I went up to the bar where I found a security guard who told me if I wanted food to order with a server. I approached a server and when the gentleman with the bandana saw me, he approached me to tell me that he already told our party what and where we had to go to order food. I advised him I was told something different at the bar and he began to get loud with me. 

If I had to order food at the bar, I had no problem with it. There's no need to be rude, or to approach someone questioning them. I have / had no reason to lie, I just wanted food. I think the service was horrible, and server said he didn't want to serve our table because he was "leaving soon". We were there for a couple hours and he was still working, so I don't know what he meant. 

Needless to say, never going again.

This by far is the best place I have eaten EVER!!!!  The grilled shrimp is is amazing words can not explain how good. We also ordered the coconut mahi bites and were blow away! I am stuffed and still want more! They also have great draft beer and friendly staff! I wish I could give this more than 5 stars!!  We will definitely make this a stop on every visit we make to Tampa!!

Would not recommend. We ordered Skinny Margaritas, queso and fish tacos. The queso and tacos came out at the same time. So much for an appetizer. And the drinks didn't come until we were almost done with our meal. We asked about the delay and the waitress said the bar was backed up, but the restaurant was only half full. When we finally got our drinks they were not the "skinny" versions we were expecting and they were so bad, my sister decided not to even drink hers. The view is nice but not worth the trip.

When you first arrive you have to leave your car at the valet parking (which is free, only had to tip the guys). We were a party of 5 (3 adults, 2 children), went for lunch around 1pm on a Thursday and the place wasn't crowded at all. We were seated immediately and our table had a lovely view of the bay. The attention was excellent (I don't recall the name of the waiter but he was an older man, very kind and attentive, the fifth star is totally for him). Our food came in about ten minutes, and word of advice: the plates are huge. We had two houses favorites: the Joe's Islas Carnitas and the Swashbuckler's basket, both great, even though they weren't exactly healthy. The kids menu was very good too, and it comes with dessert and a kid's drink. R price/food is good in my opinion. 
After eating we went to the beach and their barefoot bar. The staff is really nice, there is fresh water to wash up after a bath in the bay water and restrooms. If you don't mind the seaweed is a really great beach. The kids loved it. There are shadow seats and chairs for those who want to take some sun. It really is a place for everyone, and you only have to pay for what you consume. 
We didn't stay long enough for the sunset and evening shows, but that's only a reason for returning!

Food was barely okay. Grouper sandwich was a baby-baby grouper sandwich and slightly undercooked. Fries are good-but at the prices you clearly understand you're  here for the view and experience.  It's a Pretty cool place with music and a sometimes a band or DJ!  And beachside dining on this side of tampa bay is awesome for a quick day out.

We saw this restaurant across the way from our bay front Best Western hotel and decided, based on the Jamaican music and the fire pits on the beach that we had to check it out.

 Started out with "Joe's Pile of Nachos".  They offered to do the extra toppings on the side, which was perfect since my fiance doesn't know what's good and doesn't like sour cream or guacamole.  They were good and plentiful, really probably too big of an appetizer for two.  

My fiance got their signature 1/2 pound burger and I got the signature salad since I was so full from the nachos. We also both imbibed on their hurricane cocktails, which at $8 each was a little pricey.

Our server was friendly and willing to offer recommendations, telling us what she liked only at the end of the night to confess that she'd actually never eaten there and asked if she'd been convincing.  I was a little taken aback.  And it kind of put a sour note to our dinner.  

What this restaurant has going for it is its location. I've had better food and service.

Just be careful with the Valet staff, I had just taken my phone out of my Lifeproof case to charge it and put it up on the dash. 
Halfway home realized it wasnt where I put it, tore the car apart this morning and it is gone.

Ehhh. Sorry guys. The majority of food here is pretty awful.

Sure. It is in a beautiful location. Nice beach bar with a view of the water and a water-side bar. The place is packed on weekends. They have their margaritas and seafood. 

The place is mostly inhabited my a past-middle-aged crowd, which I guess have horrible taste buds  since most of their generation has been eating food out of cans which was all the rage in their youth and most of their adult years. The food is severely overpriced for the taste. 

They do give a portion of their earnings to the Big Cat Rescue in Tampa, which is cool. 

The best part of my experience in this restaurant was my server Allison, which was peppy, fun, and attentive.

Got some major beef with this popsicle stand. DO NOT GO AT LOW TIDE (unless ur in to that). When my homies walked into the tiki bar area, they got hosed by some dude pretending to be a bouncer who charged them each a bogus $5 cover. Food is overpriced and there was some trash Kennedy Chesney cover band playing the same three songs all night. I kindly asked the wannabe Mr. Chesney to play some 80's Joel and he flipped me off. WTF?!? Other that that, beach volleyball was great! Except for these two kids kept starting beef with my team. They were only like 6yo but they were talkin some of the heaviest heat I've felt in years. 
Tampa is weird place and this place surely screams Tampa.

Location is amazing off the beach. Great view from the table out to the water. If it wasn't due to the location I don't think this place would still be in business anywhere else. Went with a big crowd of 12 ppl. There was a long wait for the table. I was so disappointed to wait so long for bland food. Had 3 shrimp tacos which tasted like frozen shrimp from the grocery store. I only ate one. Didn't like anything anyone else ordered.  I won't be back.

Whiskey Joe's is my go-to place for lazy Sunday afternoons. Their location is like having 3 places in one: the beach bar down below, the indoor restaurant and bar, and outdoor deck on the west side. 

I like to go up on the deck and have a few beers and maybe an appetizer while waiting for the sunset, which can be pretty spectacular. The beer is always cold and service at the bar has been good in my experience.

Came here for a graduation dinner-they reserved a huge table for myself and about 8 other loud New Jersey natives.

Decent priced drinks & food. Nothing spectacular about the food tho. The crab and artichoke dip was basically all i had--which was good but obviously not so fresh. Also, vegetarians beware--BACON is in everything. I wanted to try the beer soup so bad..but bacon. i was told by the waitress the clam chowder was free of bacon--nope not true. watch out!

really nice view, the outdoor beach looks awesome! really cool concept!

Valet parking but i believe you gotta pay.

I visited Whiskey Joe's this past weekend with a group of people ranging in ages from 25 to 85 and everyone had a great time.  We thoroughly enjoyed the view from the beach area.  The option to have both the indoor and outdoor bars suited the needs for everyone in our group.  We ate dinner under a tent, the shrimp tacos I ordered were average, the shrimp had a good flavor but the other fillings weren't anything special.  If you like extra cheesy pizza give their pizza a try! The atmosphere can't be beat for a fun time in the sun!

It's a good simple place. They have free valet parking and friendly hosts. There is a patio over the bay that nice but not great. The food and menu were decent but a bit dull.

Great place to doc your boat or hangout on the beach or by the water but food is not so great unless looking for maybe burgers and fries or chips and dip. We went hoping for fresh seafood on the water and not a very good assortment on the menu for that.  Customer service was a little off too. Everyone was very nice but our app took forever and we barely saw our waitress.

Right on the water.  If you sit at the bar you can eat with your toes in the sand.  Fish tacos have large amount of fish and are tasty.
Food was very good, but the best part is the sunset on the deck or beer garden.  Beautiful view of the bay around sunset.

We went here because we were in the area and had a coupon for a free appetizer. The view is absolutely gorgeous!! The place was relatively empty when I went (probably because it was at 1pm on a Monday afternoon) but that was fine with me. We had couple of drinks and tried the  sauage and shrimp quesadillas. Everything was delicious. The servers were friendly (even though I had to ask the server for water like 3x before I actually got it). The only draw back here is that they are kinda pricey. The entrees were $20 +/- each. Yikes! Before the discount was applied, the two drinks and one appetizer were $34. May or may not go back, depends on whether or not I come into a chunk of money to splurge. :0)

We needed a place for a group of 12 with a variety of meal budgets and Whisky Joe's meet the bill. Would I take a date to this place to impress her? Nope. I would guess this is a place populated mainly by tourists.  You can view the menu and make reservations on line. There is mandatory valet parking. 

The setting is ideal, most tables will have an expansive view of the bay. However, the place is very tried and in need of an update to carpet and furniture which I'm sure won't come until there are new owners. We had a reservation so waiting was not as issue. But on the Sunday night we went, there were many tables available. In one word, this place is hugh!!

We were greeted quickly by our high energy waitress who answered our questions competently, if not a bit bluntly. The menu was somewhat limited but daily specials add to the variety. We ordered appetizers which included fried calamai, nachos, and queso and chips. All appetizer portions are plentiful and can be shared amongst two or three people. The calamri strips were large and meaty but few amongst the peppers and onions with which they are served. The queso was just a notch about velveta. The nachos had to be sent back for guacamole which had been left off. The problem was attended to and quickly remedied.

The fish boards, specials of the day were variable. I choose the swordfish and this was a mistake. The fish was thinly sliced and this made it impossible to cook properly. I ordered grilled and had I been doing the grilling, this piece of fish would have been done in 1 minute flat. Others at the table had snapper which was judged to be better. You also select a sauce and a topping for the fish. Mine was chipotle mayo which was thick, but tasty.

Other entre's ordered included the Yuengling beer can chicken which is a whole, small hen marinated and roasted on a can of, you guessed it, Yuengling beer. The chicken was moist and flavorful. The fish and chips and seafood gumbo and fish taco's were given thumbs up. We did not order deserts.

Despite the size of the party, no automatic gratuity was added and our waitress was accommodating of a request for separate checks.

All in all, everyone liked the place. It was exactly what we needed given the budgets. Dress is Florida casual which mean just about anything goes.
